title: Technical Data Engineering Lead
description:
Schneider Electric is leading the Digital Transformation of Energy Management and Automation in Homes, Buildings, Data Centers, Infrastructure, and Industries.With global presence in over 100 countries, Schneider is the undisputable leader in Power Management ‚Äì Medium Voltage, Low Voltage and Secure Power, and in Automation Systems. We provide integrated efficiency solutions, combining energy, automation, and software.We believe that great people and partners make Schneider a great company and that our commitment to Innovation, Diversity and Sustainability ensures that LifeIsOn everywhere, for everyone and at every moment.

Job purpose: 
A Technical Data Lead is the senior-level role responsible for overseeing the technical aspects of data management and analytics initiatives within our DCR Data CoE organization. He/she plays a crucial role in driving the organization's data technical delivery strategy, ensuring the availability, integrity, lineage and security of data, and leveraging data assets to drive business insights and decision-making. Technical Data Lead will work closely with the data engineering team and collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and implement data for the products / use cases owned.

Key core responsibilities include:
‚Ä¢ Technical Leadership and Team management: Providing technical leadership and guidance to the data engineering team. This involves building and managing the team: hiring, mentoring, and coaching team members, sharing best practices, providing guidance, and ensuring the team's technical skills and knowledge are up to date.
‚Ä¢ Data Solutions: Collaborating with stakeholders, such as product owners, business counterparts and data scientists, to understand their data requirements and support the data design solutions accordingly. The Technical Lead team is responsible for designing data models, data integration architectures, and data pipelines to meet use cases needs.
‚Ä¢ Data Pipeline Development: Leading the development of data pipelines that extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources into SE data lake IDS. This includes implementing data transformation logic, data cleansing, and data enrichment processes to ensure data quality and usability.
‚Ä¢ Data Architecture: Collaborating in designing the data architecture for efficient storage, retrieval, and analysis of data. The Data Engineer. Support the data platform owners and infrastructure teams to optimize data storage, data partitioning, and data indexing strategies.
‚Ä¢ Performance Optimization: optimizing the performance of data pipelines and data storage systems following the monitoring SLA and guidance from Platform Owner. Identifying performance bottlenecks, optimizing query performance, and supporting GTS ensuring scalability and reliability of data solutions.
‚Ä¢ Data Governance and Security: Implementing data governance practices and security measures to ensure data integrity, privacy, and compliance working closely with data governance and security teams to define and enforce data policies, access controls, and data protection measures.
‚Ä¢ Communication: communicate technical concepts and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Technology Evaluation and Adoption: participate in PoCs for new technologies, tools, and frameworks related to data engineering. Stays up to date with industry trends and advancements, assesses their relevance to the organization's needs, and makes recommendations for technology adoption to platform owners.
‚Ä¢ Quality Assurance: Implementing data quality checks, testing strategies, and monitoring mechanisms to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data. It establishes data validation processes and collaborates with data quality teams to address any data issues.
‚Ä¢ Continuous Improvement: Driving continuous improvement in data engineering practices. This includes identifying opportunities for automation, process optimization, and efficiency gains. The Technical Lead promotes the adoption of best practices, standardization, and reusability in data engineering projects / products.

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.‚Ä¢ 5 to 10 years of relevant experience in delivering data, analytics, or AI solutions.‚Ä¢ Strong foundations in data engineering principles, data modeling, architectural mindset, ETLs processes.‚Ä¢ Knowledge on programming languages commonly used in data engineering such as Python, SQL, or Java. ‚Ä¢ Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).‚Ä¢ 3+ years of relevant experience in Agile model / scrum.‚Ä¢ Team & talent management.‚Ä¢ Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.‚Ä¢ Evidence on leadership skills and sense of risk, urgencies (act like owner)‚Ä¢ Familiarity with product management tools, such as Jira, Confluence or Trello.‚Ä¢ Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet tight deadlines‚Ä¢ Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Why us?Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive. ‚Ç¨25.7bn global revenue137 000+ employees in 100+ countries45% of revenue from IoT5% of revenue devoted for R&D
You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: BI Data Analyst
description:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. Under its four leading online travel agency brands ‚Äì eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo ‚Äì it serves more than 17 million customers per year across 45 markets. Listed on the Spanish Stock Market, eDreams ODIGEO works with over 665 airlines and has partnerships with 130. The brand offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for consumers across the globe.
We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst who has experience working with analytics tools such as BigQuery/Microstrategy/DataStudio and knowledge of Python, R programming language.
The BI Data Analyst will work on data and analytics helping to manage data sets, marketing data bases and processes in Google Cloud Platform. Provide support to business analyst and business owners on analysis of data, queries and dashboards.
In this role, you would be responsible for working with multi-disciplinary teams ‚Äì Qualitative Researchers, Designers, Product Owners, Developers, and Pricing Managers ‚Äì to blend different statistical and data analytics techniques to generate a holistic understanding of the users and markets.
What you will do:
 Analyse performance and identify behaviours in different data sets;  Data mining and automated reports/dashboards;  Translate complex and potentially ambiguous information into clear structure and actionable deliverables. Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality,  Build and maintain dashboards and/or reports to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders,  Identify and analyse relevant customer data to drive business goals and validate hypothesis & designs; turn data into actionable insights,  Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge. 
About you:
 Data-driven with a strong analytical and problem-solving capability,  Minimum 3 years of experience as an analyst in a digital and eCommerce environment,  Strong knowledge of tools and programming languages such as BigQuery/SQL, Python; R,  Knowledge of Business Intelligence visualization tools such as Microstrategy, Datastudio.  Self-starter with good time management skills, able to manage multiple tasks and prioritize quickly the most relevant ones,  Ability to multitask, desire to work in a challenging, fast-paced, high-performance environment,  Team player with a positive attitude and sense of humor.  English is a must. 
What we offer:
 We support a phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance with our flexible hours and flexible remote work policy.  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.  Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.  Free subscription to Coursera Learning Platform.  Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.  We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy.  New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.  Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.  Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand! 
‚Ä¶ And the opportunity to work on a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!
Come dream with us and join us now!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Metadata Analyst
description:
Mission:
Within the Data and Performance Team, Data Excellence is a cross-functional team responsible for promoting a data culture across the Schneider Group, through the dissemination of its operating model (DeXOM). Metadata management is the core capability upon which DeXOM relies, and the Data Intelligence Analyst should help implement and maintain a reliable and sustainable metadata environment. The tool chosen to achieve this goal is Data Intelligence Portal.
Key responsibilities:
Edit communication materials and manage stakeholder involvementLead training sessions for users, targeted for all of SchneiderDesign and monitor relevant dashboards for metadata managementParticipate in the functional management of data managersDevelop and improve new or existing workflows for the data governance communityParticipate in the design, implementation and monitoring of automatic metadata extractions, and the exploration of their contentSupport the definition of a start-up methodology in Data Intelligence Portal, for a project team or for a functionBe the partner of metadata managers to collect the needs and guarantee the integration, enrichment and consumption of new metadataEnsure version upgrades and implementation of corrections, for all Data Governance technologiesLead user support meetings
Skills and attributes:
You should have at least 2 years of experience in data governance, metadata management, data modelling, and data architecture conceptsYou must have experience in metamodel designExperience in defining and implementing the glossary of business termsExperience in the design and parameterization of metadata types and their modellingExperience in using API connections to ensure the integration of other systems with the Data Governance platformUnderstanding of technical metadata and their relationship to business metadata, i.e., with data elements, measures, indicators, etc.You must have very strong communication skillsGood managerial skills to lead and coordinate the metadata team
Desirable:
Have already used the Collibra environment in depth: its operating model, workflows, dashboards and other functionalitiesExperience in methodologies and software of knowledge graphs
 
Education
Required level of education: Master's degree or higher (economics or computer science or data management)

title: Senior Data Analyst - Marketing Analytics
description:
Back Market is the world‚Äôs leading refurbished electronics marketplace with a team of 700 people, powering operations in 17 countries (and counting!).
Named one of the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company in 2019 and again in 2021, our mission is simple: empowering people to consume tech sustainably by offering folks a high quality, accessible, and more eco-friendly alternative to buying new electronics. Why? Refurbished tech helps lower our collective environmental impact . We have indeed contributed to avoid the production of more than 1,000,000‚ÄØtons of CO2e worldwide since our launch in 2014.
Be part of an exciting and growing international adventure that will change the way the world consumes tech.
As an expert on all things that relate to media incrementality, and measurement methodologies, you will be part of our Marketplace Analytics team supporting strategic decisions to maximize the growth and profitability of our marketplace.
YOUR MISSION (IF YOU ACCEPT IT): üèÖ
Build measurement plans for marketing campaigns (brand & performance) to understand their incremental impact (e.g. conversion lift tests) and bring to surface key insights to optimize their impactUse sophisticated modeling techniques such as causal inference to analyze campaign results and report the media effectiveness across all stakeholder groupsDrive budget allocation across multi marketing channelsCollaborate with expert partners such as Google, Meta, TikTok to design state of the art experimentsDevelop processes to ensure all stakeholders align and understand how we determine marketing campaign successWork closely with internal collaborators including Marketing, Finance, Country General Managers to develop marketing strategies based on your insightsLiaising with the top management, casting light on the best possible strategy levers to increase our marketing efficiency, connecting marketing & finance teams on a regular basisBe a key driver of marketing strategy, by thinking beyond immediate analysis to understand the long-term implications of actions
YOU ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE IF: ‚≠ê
5-8+ years of relevant industry experience working in digital marketing (e.g., Google Analytics, Performance Incrementality, Multi Touch Attribution) and a degree (Masters or PhD) in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Operations Research)Experience as a marketing analyst using statistical techniques (e.g., hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, significance testing)Experience in campaign brand lift measurement and using problem solving insights to guide media planningExperience partnering with internal teams to drive action and providing expertise and direction on analytics, experimental design, and measurementStrong knowledge of SQL, Python/R and statisticsAdvanced experimentation experience including causal analysisExperience in marketplaces and growth are a plus
RECRUITMENT PROCESS: üìÖ
Recruiter Interview with Julien, Talent Acquisition ManagerTechnical interview and case study with Christophe, Head of AnalyticsBusiness Interview with Marketing DirectorsFinal Back Market Value Interview
WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US ? ‚úåüèº
 A meaningful job: you will help avoid thousands of tons of electronic waste and fight against planned obsolescence. It counts! A meaningful company: we became a mission-driven company in January 2022. Be part of a worldwide growing company based in Europe, the USA and Asia to face great challenges : you will have the freedom to innovate and adopt new ideas! Work alongside passionate experts: who will share their knowledge and help you develop and grow in your career. Grow your career: with a flexible career path and a dedicated Learning & Development team. Back Market will help you evolve with personalized internal trainings and external handpicked providers from day 1! Leadership Academy by Back Market:‚Äúbe a coach not a dictator‚Äù is at the core of this program ! We train and enable all our leaders to support their team towards achieving goals. Be a manager at Back Market is an unique experience we take by heart. An attractive salary, equity and a host of benefits including : Lunch voucher, health insurance, relocation package, paid time off for activism in your community, parental benefits, flexible hours, etc‚Ä¶ Remote friendly company : up to 3 days of remote work per week! One Loving Tribe: you will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, open-minded and friendly environment. Be part of one of our Employee Resource Groups createdaround shared identities, common backgrounds and/or special interests crafted to be a safe space and an expressive outlet. Several internal events: The Monday Brief (weekly)/ The Somehands (monthly)/ The All Hands (annual). We‚Äôre here to SABOTAGE: It‚Äôs our mantra. It keeps us focused on what we aspire to be: a little bit sneaky, always smart, kinda frugal and constantly conspiring to create maximum impact.
Back Market is an Equal Opportunity Employer which means we pledge to not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetic information.. If reasonable accommodations are needed for the interview process, please do not hesitate to discuss this with the Talent Acquisition Team.
Back Market is helping to address one of the biggest challenges of our time: climate change. We take this so seriously that we were awarded status as a ‚ÄúSoci√©t√© √† Mission‚Äù, or company with a social mission, by the French government. We know we can‚Äôt tackle a global problem without a globally representative team so we are committed to embedding diversity, equity and inclusion principles in every aspect of our organization. But more importantly, being One Loving & Free Spirited Tribe is in our DNA as it is one of the five foundational values of our company since we got started way back in 2014. We are committed to hiring and supporting diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We know our lofty goals cannot be reached unless everyone has a seat at the table along with the resources and opportunity to grow.

title: Data Engineer ESP
description:
Teladoc Health is transforming how people access and experience healthcare. Recognized as the world leader in virtual care, we are partnering with over a thousand clients to serve millions! of people around the globe every day. Teladoc Health offers a whole person virtual care platform that empowers all people everywhere to live their healthiest lives by transforming the healthcare experience, from acute and primary care to chronic care, mental health, and specialty care. Our team of data engineers aggregate and transform substantial amounts of health data and information to support actionable, personalized, and timely health signals for our members. This approach delivers better clinical and financial outcomes while creating a different and better healthcare experience for people everywhere. The applicant should have a strong interest in the interface between real-time and reporting systems, pulling data from multiple sources into central data storage, and collaborating with internal teams to help provide for their data needs.
Your flourish in a fast paced and highly collaborative team environment. You are a quick learner and have the expert ability to prioritize tasks efficiently, while delivering high quality work. You understand that solutions provided by a Data Engineer, support in empowering an organization‚Äôs business in decision making. You will be part of a great working atmosphere, performing complex work in a collaborative team of amazing people, with forward-thinking managers. You will have the opportunity to make an impact.
Role and Responsibilities:-Data is significant at Teladoc and our data engineers design and develop data pipelines to integrate data across disparate systems and create tools and data sets to support data science.-Work with Python, Spark SQL, Scala, TensorFlow, Keras, SKL (or Scala/DL4J) to build production-grade machine learning (ML) pipelines and tools.-Perform continuous integration to ensure that every step of a data pipeline is testable and automated.-Collaborate closely with Teladoc Health‚Äôs ML experts, Data Scientists, Product Managers, and clinical researchers to define, analyze, and provide data that contributes to our mission of total health for our members.-Document code, provide progress reports, and perform code review and peer feedback.-Track milestones, activities and inter-dependencies across projects and tasks, with frequent status updates to stakeholders.-Continuously evaluate and identify improvements in the system processes and architecture.-Assist in maintaining data quality and fidelity in production systems.-Participate in Agile planning around data feature requests and advocate for the best data engineering projects in priority planning.
Requirements:-BS degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.-3+ years‚Äô experience in software development/engineering.-2+ years‚Äô experience in a data engineering role.-Strong experience with big data technologies, and skills in data processing using Spark.-Expertise in creating and maintaining production data pipelines using Airflow.-Strong SQL development experience (Postgres/MySQL/SQL Server/Oracle).-Expertise in Python(preferred), Scala, or Java.-1+ years of experience working in Azure cloud.-Experience in performance tuning and query optimization.-Experience in Cloud data engineering in Azure stack. Azure certification is a plus.-Tool based data pipeline development experience is desirable (Talend/Informatica/ IBM Datastage).-Streaming data flow experience is desirable (Kafka).-Experience in deploying production pipelines in CI/CD environment.-Excellent communication skills, supporting recommendations, design ideas, and analysis to team and stakeholders.-Experience in leading and guiding other data engineers.

For a more detailed look at our company and values, visit our website at https://www.teladochealth.com/
At Teladoc Health we thrive on difference and individuality. Teladoc Health is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

title: Data Analyst
description:
What about us?
Sunhero is a residential solar energy company on a mission to make access to clean, PV solar energy easy and affordable. We leverage technology and innovation to accelerate the transition to clean energy.
Sunhero was founded in 2021 by Christopher Cederskog and Stefan Braun. Two entrepreneurs with over 25 years of experience launching companies in the international markets, including Airbnb, Rover, and Course Hero. Sunhero is Berlin-founded and Barcelona-headquartered.
We raised our series A investment round of 10M‚Ç¨ in March 2023. This round was led by climate tech VC Planet A and Vorwerk Ventures, as well as Redstone, All Iron Ventures, and Speedinvest .
We started in Spain, but climate change knows no borders. And neither will we. Want to know more? Please visit Sunhero.com .
What we want to achieve together?
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring data quality and integrity, collaborating with stakeholders across departments, and providing valuable insights through data analysis. You will play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making and optimizing our sales processes.
Key Responsibilities:
 Sales reporting and forecasting: Establish a robust reporting framework, providing timely and accurate reports on sales performance, KPIs, and forecasts to aid in decision-making and drive business growth. Capacity planning optimization: Utilise historical data and statistical models to develop capacity planning strategies, optimising resource allocation and addressing potential bottlenecks in our sales and after-sales processes to enhance operational efficiency and customer satisfaction. Process improvements: Identify opportunities to streamline and automate data collection, reporting, and analysis processes to enhance data accessibility, reduce manual efforts, and increase overall efficiency. Ensure data quality assurance: Maintain data quality and integrity by implementing data governance practices and performing regular data audits. Collaborate with stakeholders: Work closely with sales and other teams to understand their needs and align data analysis with business objectives.
What do you need to be successful in this role?
 Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a sales or marketing environment. Strong SQL and data modeling background Familiar with data visualization tools (such as Looker, Tableau) and comfortable telling stories through dashboards. Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to identify patterns, trends, and insights from complex data sets. Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Passion for sustainability and clean energy solutions. Fluent in both English and Spanish.
What will you find working at Sunhero:
 This is a hybrid position. You can work some days at home and some days at our beautiful office in Barcelona (Utopicus, Diagonal 532). If you are working from home -or other locations- our working hours are CET +/- 2hs. This is a meaningful job: we are driven by the desire to make a positive impact. You will get the chance to drive environmental improvements for our planet and shape the path of one of Southern Europe‚Äôs most promising solar panel startups. It‚Äôs a chance to work with and learn from an experienced, diverse, inclusive, and international team. We are 19+ nationalities at Sunhero. You will have a flexible working schedule based on ownership and autonomy of your role. This is a working parent-friendly environment. 80% of our leadership are parents themselves. You can access Flexible Retribution benefits from a single mobile app. You can also access your earned wages in advance, at any time of the month. We have monthly lunch and monthly breakfast at the office. You are more than welcome to come and share quality time with us! You and your family will have access to top quality Medical Health Insurance. You can enjoy flexibility on your personal time off (vacations and working from abroad) and leaves (paternity, maternity, sick leaves)
Diversity & Inclusion
Diversity and inclusion are important to us, and we‚Äôre constantly working to improve these aspects. At Sunhero, we don‚Äôt just accept our differences, we fully support and celebrate them. We‚Äôre committed to equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, or gender identity or expression. We strive to be an equal opportunity workplace. Furthermore, we want all candidates to feel safe and comfortable while participating in Sunhero interviews and hiring processes: if you need any adaptations or accommodations during the hiring process, please let us know during the application process.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Location: Budapest ‚Äì Sanofi Business Services, V√°ci GreensFlexible working: 60% home office / weekJob type: Permanent, Full time

About The Job

We are an innovative global healthcare company, driven by one purpose: we chase the miracles of science to improve people‚Äôs lives. Our team, across some 100 countries, is dedicated to transforming the practice of medicine by working to turn the impossible into the possible. We provide potentially life-changing treatment options and life-saving vaccine protection to millions of people globally, while putting sustainability and social responsibility at the center of our ambitions.

Our Data Team is driving ADAPT, a global program to transform Sanofi commercial data landscape in key markets. Reporting directly to the program lead, this Data Analyst position offers the opportunity to take part in this exciting initiative.

About Growing With Us

In this role you will‚Ä¶

Manage both data & business needs, leveraging a deep understanding of business processes and technology to help business stakeholders achieve their desired outcomesPerform data modeling, process modeling, data management through the warehouse - processes, data quality auditing and logging to benchmark. This also requires the ability to report out the state of data quality, help with preparation of data verification and testing methods, and process automation. Identify and analyze business requirements for data use, analysis, and quality, as well as coordinate between stakeholder groups to address them and deliver prompt, efficient, quality serviceCommunicate solution tradeoffs to business stakeholders to frame and influence project decisionsIdentify new opportunities to leverage data and to integrate data or applications to enhance business valueDeliver in compliance with quality, regulatory (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX, etc.) and cybersecurity requirements

About You

Expert in data manipulation, data quality and audit techniquesGood understanding of cloud computing and data solution designKnowledge of ETL/ELT, Snowflake, SQL, Informatica, AWSBachelor‚Äôs degree in computer sciences or equivalent professional experienceSignificant work experience as Data Analyst (performed data manipulation, data analysis, data management) - experience with commercial data sets and/or in healthcare company is a strong plusYou are an accountable team player, able to communicate and collaborate effectively with various profiles of stakeholders

When joining our team, you will experience:

An international work environment, in which you can develop your talent and realize ideas and innovations within a competent teamAn attractive, market-oriented salary and cafeteria benefitsFlexible home office policy, with a possibility to work up to 60% of time from home / where you can easiliy schedule your office daysWork from an "Office of the Year 2020" finalist officeCollective life and accident insuranceYearly medical check-upAn individual and well-structured introduction and training of new employees and we will dedicate a Buddy for you to better navigate in your first weeksYour own career path within Sanofi. Your professional and personal development will be supported purposefullyJoin a great community & special events (Monthly Board Game Nights, Summer Events, Well-Being Lectures & Sport Clubs)

Pursue progress, discover extraordinary

Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn‚Äôt happen without people ‚Äì people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let‚Äôs be those people.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Discover our Code of Conduct, that serves as the moral compass that guides us when chasing the miracles of science to improve people‚Äôs lives. Please ensure to have read this document, before applying.

#Sanofi #WeNeverSettle #SanofiCareers #PursueProgress #DiscoverExtraordinary #joinsanofi #careerswithpurpose #SBSBUDAPEST

At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

title: Odoo Developer & Data Analyst
description:
About The Job
We are looking for a skilled and experienced Odoo Developer who is also proficient in data analysis and reporting using Superset or other BI reporting tool. The successful candidate will be expected to take the existing processes of our company, migrate them to the Odoo platform, and build detailed reports in Superset or other BI reporting tool with all the company's KPIs. The ideal candidate should be able to improve our business processes and workflows to maximize efficiency and maintain data integrity.
About You
You will be working in a very dynamic environment, which means that you must have a strong problem-solving ability, organization skills, and be proactive. About the necessary skills for this position, we are looking for an analytical person with great communication and time management abilities.
In terms of personality, we are looking for someone who enjoys working in a wide range of areas and adapts quickly to new situations.
The successful candidate should be a self-starter, able to work with minimal supervision, and have a passion for efficiency, problem-solving, and continuous improvement. This role requires strategic thinking, collaboration, and communication skills, as well as technical expertise
Tareas
Tasks
You will have to feel comfortable giving support to the rest of the team and you can definitely expect to:
Migrate and implement existing company processes to the Odoo platform.
Configure, install and maintain Odoo modules according to business needs.Develop and customize Odoo modules for the company when necessary.Extract, analyze, and report data from Odoo using Superset or other BI reporting tool for effective decision-making and strategic planning.Generate and deliver KPI reports regularly, highlighting significant insights and trends.Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into operational requirements and solutions.Assist in troubleshooting and resolving any issues within the Odoo system and Superset or other BI reporting tool reports.Ensure that all integrations with Odoo are working smoothly and optimize as necessary.Continually test the performance and functionality of the Odoo system and Superset or other BI reporting tool reports to ensure all features are working correctly and efficiently

Requisitos
What We Are Looking For
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.Proven experience as an Odoo Developer or in a similar role, with a strong portfolio of Odoo projectsKnowledge of web technologies, such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and PythonExperience with Superset or other BI reporting tool or similar data visualization toolsSolid understanding of business process and business process management.Experience in implementing some type of ERP (SAP, Oracle, MicrosoftDynamics365...)Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.Fluent English and Spanish.Odoo certification is a plus

Beneficios
What We Offer
45.000‚Ç¨ Yearly salary.Indefinite full-time contract.Company profit-sharing scheme valued at up to ‚Ç¨15,000 per year.Flexible remuneration with restaurant tickets, transport tickets, nursery, training, and medical insurance.Flexible schedule, with the possibility of home office.28 days of vacations per year.A warm, transparent and supportive team, with a huge emphasis on work-life balance.The opportunity to make your mark in e-health and AI.

About IOMED
IOMED is a leading technology start-up company in the field of massive medical data extraction and processing. It is made up of a united, young, dynamic, and flexible team, which, after several years of working together, is characterized by its agility, enjoyment of work, and rapport. Accordingly, we are looking for candidates with the desire to innovate, launch a relevant project, and grow with it, always enjoying teamwork and challenges, which are many, every day.
As an employer, we offer equal opportunity. We want to grow our team with talented, dynamic people who want to make their mark in the field of AI and research, regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, physical disability, or age.
What We Do
Nowadays, there is still great difficulty in accessing Real-World Data (Real-World Data), which are those contained in Electronic Health Records (EHR), since up to 85% of the existing clinical data is not structured. This represents a loss of opportunity for the sector to improve its healthcare processes and clinical research.
IOMED has developed a Natural Language Processing solution that extracts and transforms clinical data into an international and federated model, OMOP CDM, resulting in a structured, standardized, and interoperable database that contains complete clinical information from hospitals.
In this way, professionals and the industry can make use of this data and obtain evidence based on all the data, Real World Evidence, that has essential value when it comes to making decisions, among others. All this, in addition, to assuring the protection and governance of the data at all times.

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
About EXOGROUP: 
EXOGROUP is a set of companies made up of +180 talents and offering a wide range of services within the digital business landscape with headquarters in Barcelona and offices in Dublin, Porto, Valencia, Tarragona, and Buenos Aires.
We are revolutionizing the online ad-serving industry for advertisers, publishers, and networks alike and are seeking to recruit an Junior Data Analyst for our Barcelona office.
The Role: 
As a Junior Data Analyst you will be part of the Business Intelligence team at EXOGROUP, which is a highly skilled and qualified department that has diverse responsibilities.
Together with the Director of Business Intelligence and Data Analysts you will develop and maintain weekly, monthly and quarterly reports that provide critical business visibility on key revenue and profit trends, by product, market, vertical and traffic sources. Additionally, based on detailed analysis of the segment, you will collaborate with the IT team to identify potential improvement in the intelligence platform by analysing and designing algorithms.
Responsibilities: 
Structure masses of information, identify data-driven trends and understand what really matters and why.Collect KPIs and design/define visualizations.Deliver insights and analytics across the company's operation and advertising departments.Ability to identify and escalate issues and opportunities ahead of time helping to reduce impact and improve financial / performance implications.Develop and maintain different internal applications and dashboards.Together with the Business Intelligence team, you will develop and promote actionable insights to increase the profitability of the company.
You have:
You thrive on data and have a highly analytical mind.Degree in information technology or mathematical sciences.Managing and prioritising workload, taking ownership of all assigned tasks.You feel comfortable retrieving, cleaning, tidying and processing data from different sources and formats. You have a general understanding of how web applications work.You have programming experience in Python.You are familiar with SQL.Experience with advanced statistical methodology, data and datasets is a plus.Strong verbal and written communication skills.The desire and agility to work in a fast-paced and ever evolving environment
What you'll find working at EXOGROUP :
We offer a position in a young, dynamic and international team with exceptional working conditions in unique offices high up in the Torre Mapfre, one of Barcelona's world-renowned landmarks, located right on the city's seafront.Additionally, we offer the opportunity for permanent training, personal development, ambitious career growth, and a competitive salary.Most of all, we offer a position in a team that thrives on achievement, success, and leadership within our industry. Our core company value is innovation: where people and creativity drive innovative technology. If you have an innovative, winning mentality, this position is for you!
Our company benefits:
Flexitime and summer schedule Private health insuranceYour Birthday off as a paid holidayFlexible compensation plan: travel, meals & childcareAdditional internal and external training through our EXOGROUP University programEnglish, Portuguese & Spanish classestraining budget & study leave Employee referral program bonus - You can earn 2500Eur by referring someone!Exciting team buildings in locations such as IbizaOffice games room/chill-out zoneOrganic fruitWednesday team breakfastYoga classesMassages Subsidized cateringHybrid remote workHome office set up budget of 500 Eur
Is this not the right role for you? Then make sure to check out all other roles we have open for you on our careers website.
The companies that are part of EXOGROUP are the data controllers regarding your personal data, in order to consider your application for present or future vacancies in our organization. For more information about the processing of your personal data and on how to exercise your rights of access, rectification, suppression, limitation, portability and opposition please visit the Protection Informative Clause Candidates.

title: Head of Data Science
description:
We are currently seeking a Head of Data Science to join our Data team at Kiwi. In this role, you will be responsible for leading and building our Data Science team, which will focus on developing advanced analytics, data science, machine learning, and AI solutions to address various business problems in a customer-centric environment.

At Kiwi, we recognize that a culture of learning, adaptation, and experimentation is crucial to achieving our growth goals, and we believe that Data Science is a key element of this culture.

As our Head of Data Science, you will have the opportunity to help shape and recruit our Data Science team, as well as lead the development, building, and deployment of data science solutions to a variety of problems. We are committed to establishing the best and most up-to-date data science practices in our team, ensuring that we innovate at scale and speed.

In this role, you will work closely with business leaders and analytical teams, serving as the Data Science lead on a variety of use cases that range from ad-hoc advanced analytics solutions and small-scale bespoke simulations to the deployment of machine learning models in a production environment.

Responsibilities 

Building and leading a team of data scientists and establishing best practices and modern software development techniques to learn, build and scale data science solutions.Collaborating with the business to design and develop solutions that effectively solve business problems.Demonstrating a deep understanding of methodologies and approaches to effectively communicate trade-offs and nuances of approach to both technical and non-technical audiences.Working closely with the data community to build capabilities, mentor and influence others on the importance of data science.Sourcing, determining and assessing the availability and quality of data to ensure it is fit for purpose, and proposing steps to improve data quality if necessary.Possessing strong communication skills to articulate how problems can be solved using a data-driven approach. This includes building confidence in proposals and solutions, creating narratives, and providing clarity and comprehension of the solution.

Technical Requirements 

Experience in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field.Strong expertise in statistics, machine learning, and data mining.Experience with programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.Experience with big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka.Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, GCP or Azure.Ability to design, implement and optimize data pipelines and ETL processes.Experience with deploying machine learning models in a production environment.Understanding of distributed computing architectures and algorithms.

What you will need? 

Experience in data science, with experience in a leadership role.Strong experience in leading and building high-performing data science teams.Proven track record of delivering data-driven solutions to solve complex business problems.Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think strategically.Strong project management skills, with experience in managing multiple projects simultaneously.Experience with agile software development methodologies.

What We Offer You 

The opportunity to join our Phantom Stock scheme.We give our employees a freedom to choose between the environment of work from home and our modern office located in the centric neighborhood (Passeig de Gr√†cia) in Cloudworks coworking space where you can enjoy Kiwi.com‚Äôs private office space, two common terraces with great views, common coworking activities (yoga, games, etc.), free refreshments and shower.We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days, sick days, private medical insurance, Employee Assistance Program, GymForLess membership, the annual subscription for El Bicing. Flight vouchers to celebrate your kiwi anniversaries.The latest version of Hardware from Apple or Microsoft based on your preferences.We offer unlimited contracts within a forward-thinking and ambitious company.Relocation package (including visa transfer support).Dogs and parties are welcome in our offices.
Interested? Join us and hack the traditional ways of travel!

Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it‚Äôs finished, we‚Äôre going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/ .

title: Data Analyst
description:
What Is Exoticca?

Do you like traveling? Do you enjoy the exotic? Do you like strong challenges? If the answer is YES, welcome to Exoticca!

Exoticca is a company that started in 2013 by professionals specialized in the creation and online distribution of voyages. Our mission is to offer our clients the possibility to visit the most beautiful and stimulating places on our planet, through the best holiday packages, at unbelievable prices. For more comfort, our customers can find out more about our trips and book them instantly in a matter of minutes through our website, avoiding the usual long exchanges of email, meetings, or calls required by more traditional travel agencies.

At Exoticca we are looking for people who want to offer their best to create unforgettable experiences for our customers. We are a young, dynamic, multicultural team of 300+ people, in rapid international growth, seeking new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation.

We are a highly ambitious and well-funded start-up, backed by top national and international investors that have also participated in the growth of other success stories, such as SinDelantal.com, or Idealista, among others.

What is our proporsal?

The Data Analyst will be responsible for the development of a strong analytical foundation of the newly created Revenue Management team, in the Product department. He will be part of a quickly developing team, helping in the implementation of a new top-quality Revenue model in the industry.

What Wil You Do
Perform complex analysis related to precise business questions and deliver actionable insights. Liaise with the company Data team, and collaborate with Data engineers and Data scientists in the company.Be the point of reference for any matter related to data and analysis within the Revenue team.Collecting and interpreting data from different sources in our Data Lake.Provide business with meaningful dashboards or other tools.Design, develop and maintain automated processes that help business improve manual workflow.

Requirements
Quantitative degree (IT, Mathematics, Physics,Statistics). Strong knowledge of SQL.At least 2 years of experience with programming languages such as R and especially Python for data analysis and modelling.Experience building dashboards with Data visualisation tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI,..).Passion for building things from scratch.High level of English.

Benefits
Competitive compensation package in line with job responsibilities and experience.Additionally, we propose the use of flexible compensation management for diet, transportation, and private health insurance with Cobee.Hybrid work model: Offices in the heart of Barcelona (right next to Pla√ßa Catalunya).Permanent contract from the start.Travel packages at reduced prices as perk for employees!Unlimited coffee, language lessons, quarterly teamwork activities, global biannual parties.And last but not least, becoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at an agile and rapid growing organization!

Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law.

title: Senior Project Manager/ Data Analyst
description:
Job DescriptionJob Title: Project Manager/ Data AnalystLocation: Barcelona or Valencia, Spain
IT Project Manager and Data Analyst is responsible for overseeing all aspects of any project in a company‚Äôs IT department, which includes managing a team of providers and employees to ensure projects are completed on time and within their specified budgets. 
Project Manager skills:‚Ä¢Organizing and managing all phases of the project to ensure on-time completion Managing resources for projects‚Ä¢Coordinating project team members and developing schedules and individual responsibilities‚Ä¢Implementing IT strategies that deliver projects on schedule and within budget‚Ä¢Using project management tools to track project performance and schedule adherence‚Ä¢Conducting risk assessments for projects‚Ä¢Organice meetings to discuss project goals and progress‚Ä¢Performs other related duties as assigned.
Data Analyst skills:‚Ä¢Build automated reports and dashboards with the help of Power BI and other reporting tools‚Ä¢Understand business requirements to set functional specifications for reporting applications‚Ä¢Be experienced in tools and systems on MS SQL Server BI Stack, including SSRS and TSQL, Power Query, MDX, PowerBI, and DAX‚Ä¢Create functional reporting
Must Haves‚Ä¢Great collaboration skills‚Ä¢3+ Years working as an IT Project Manager‚Ä¢Experience with ERP and PMS systems‚Ä¢Over three years of experience in data preparation, data gateway, and data warehousing projects ‚Ä¢Over three years of experience working with the Microsoft Business Intelligence Stack (Power BI, SSAS, SSRS, and SSIS)‚Ä¢Two to three years of experience with a self-service tool such as Power BI or Tableau‚Ä¢Understanding of JavaScript, CSS, SQL, and other JavaScript libraries. Rest API and web scrapingn/Gender Identity/National Origin

title: Data Engineer
description:
Description
Coniq is a dynamic, high growth UK-based SaaS company that provides total customer engagement and loyalty services to many of the world‚Äôs leading property developers, shopping centers and retailers. Coniq powers well over ¬£1 billion of sales annually for its clients, with more than 20 million consumers shopping at 1,800 brands in 24 countries worldwide, and has offices in Europe, the US and the Middle East.
We are looking for a Data Engineer. The role will be responsible for maintaining, optimising and extending our enterprise MySQL databases, peripheral database systems (RDBS and Data warehouse), and data pipeline operations (ETL/ELT management), to sustain our current operational data needs, and to enable Coniq‚Äôs continued growth. Coniq leads the world in providing shopper engagement and loyalty solutions for the most advanced retail destinations and we are looking for talented individuals to join us on our journey.
Ideally, we would like this role to be based in Barcelona to spend some time with our team in the office, however, we‚Äôre open for this role to be remote in Spain.
Reports to Head of Data Operations.
Responsibilities
Maintenance, development and expanding of multiple MySQL databases and data warehousesEnsuring data management systems health and performanceCreating and optimising queries for data analysis and day-to-day data operations required by Coniq‚Äôs applicationsSupporting Data Analysts to transform client data requirements into executable queriesSynchronising data between data sources (MySQL, 3rd Partydata sources, etc.) and data store systems (MySQL, Exasol, etc.)Supporting the application development team to build, validate and optimise database interactionsMaintaining processes to ensure failover and disaster recoverySupporting the development team with data operations to facilitate software deployments
Relevant experience
You have managed a high volume, high performance MySQL database in a multi-tenancy, SaaS environment.You are highly proficient in creating, optimising and maintaining SQL queries and processes - including triggers and stored procedures.Database health and performance is central to your thinking and work - you have experience of performance tuning, optimising and partitioning data in conjunction with analysing query performance.You have designed and maintained processes to replicate data into redundant databases and into read-replica sets - including into different database systems.You have supported an application development team to ensure that all data operations are optimal to the needs of the business.You have an experience working with columnar and non-relational databasesYou have experience modeling and management of ETL/ELT processes on data flow systems; such as airflow, azkaban etc.; between tabular databases and data warehousesYou have scripting experience in Python, bash or similar scripting language
Requirements
Proactive problem solverAble to work independently, identifying problems and solutions and planning for future improvementAble to work with stakeholders that are not data expertsExcellent attention to detailHighly proficient and experienced in any Native SQL - experience of MySQL dialect essentialUnderstanding of Enterprise Queues and pipelinesUnderstanding of APIsA strong understanding of agile methodologiesProficient in Python scripting or similar scripting languageDesirable:Experience maintaining non-relational and columnar databases - Exasol, ElasticSearch, NoSQL etcPerformance tuning and data partitioningKnowledge on data infrastructures and architectures - Hybrid, SMACK, etc.

Benefits
We offer a generous package, including:Competitive salaryCompany stock options25 days holiday plus statutory holidaysA day off to celebrate your birthdayA day off for your wellbeingShorter working hours on FridaysA strong company values framework, including paid leave for volunteering with approved charitiesRegular team building activitiesTraining & development allowanceNew employee referral schemeThis is a unique opportunity to join a VC-funded high growth SaaS business where we all share a passion to work together to build a great product and a great company. We are proud of our company culture and invest a great deal into making sure that we promote Diversity in the workplace. Together we come from over 20 nationalities and as a tech business, we are very proud of the 50/50 gender split.

title: Lead Data Platform
description:
Our mission? Creating the finance solution that energizes SMEs and freelancers, so they can achieve more. We simplify everything from everyday banking to bookkeeping and spend management. At Qonto, we‚Äôre passionate about creating the best product, so if you‚Äôre looking for an ambitious team that‚Äôs revolutionizing an old-fashioned industry, get in touch!

Our journey:  Alexandre and Steve launched Qonto in July 2017. Since then, the team has earned the trust of more than 350,000 customers and opened offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, and Barcelona. Last summer, we joined forces with Penta, a market leader based in Berlin and Belgrade, forming a united team of 1000 Qontoers. We also made it to the Top 3 of LinkedIn Top Startups France !

Our values:

Ambition | We tackle big challenges. No matter what.

Teamwork | We create momentum by working together, at the same speed.

Mastery | We pursue excellence through continuous learning. We face challenges with humility. Every day.

Integrity | We're open. We're honest. And we earn the trust of our clients and each other.

You can find out more about the Qonto Way here .

Our beliefs: Our goal at Qonto is to create a warm and welcoming environment where individuals from all walks of life can truly thrive. We've gone above and beyond to ensure that every applicant is evaluated solely based on their skills and potential, rather than their gender, ethnicity, age, (dis)ability, or any other irrelevant factor. Our team consists of 49% international individuals, with 44% women and 20% parents. With this diversity, we are a powerful force! Join us in our mission to build a workplace that celebrates diversity and embraces individuality. Discover the steps we took to create a discrimination-free hiring process .

Qonto has grown a 60+ data team with Data Engineers, BI, and Data Scientists working together to deliver great dashboards, reports, and data products. Now is the time for Qonto to strengthen its data foundations. Qonto is looking for itsLead Data Platform to build its next-generation data platform.

Our vision of the Data platform

The data platform covers three key functions: governance, ingestion and data modelling. You only ingest the data Qontoers need: this is data governance. You rely on a modern data stack to ingest the data: airflow, dbt and snowflake. And you craft nice and discoverable tables and fields to be used widely at Qonto: this is data modelling. You serve all data teams: BI, Data Science, and Data Products.

There are 12 engineers in the data platform team divided into data engineers and analytics engineers.

Leading a data platform team means leading a team of 2 to 8 engineers

üë©‚Äçüíªüßë‚Äçüíª What you will achieve in this role in your first year
 Simplify the data model: during your first year, you will focus on the analytics engineering part. Analytics engineers are building two key inner layers of the data model ‚Äî the core and reference layers. Then, you will likely switch to leading hybrid teams composed of data and analytics engineers Organise your team delivery: how to make sure the core tables you deliver match the needs of data analysts? What prioritisation system to adopt? Coach and Grow your team: being a Lead at Qonto means setting your team for success Make your team shine inside and outside Qonto: you ingest clean data, transform them into nice documented tables, self-discoverable by every Qontoers. What a success! The incidents have nearly vanished and you feel proud of your team. How about you spread the word and share the key ingredients of your success?

üõ† Tech Stack:
 Our primary language is Python, our core platform consists of a Snowflake data warehouse, fueled primarily by an on site Airflow instance running on a Kubernetes cluster. Data is centralized through custom orchestrated batch jobs, with S3 as our intermediary lake. Data modelization is enabled thanks to an orchestrated dbt repository and quality validation results of a mix of tests using Great Expectations and dbt. We took advantage of ELK forlogging and monitoring as well as Airflow‚Äôs internal database.

ü§î  What you can expect
 Join Qonto who is winning SME banking in Europe. Qonto is on track to power one million SMEs in 2025. Develop dozens of customer-impacting innovative data products ranging from understanding better our clients, to Qonto app killer features Work with a top-notch team Leverage our values and our culture of continuous improvement to boost your impact as a leader

ü§ù Your future Manager

J√©r√©mie , VP of Data, will be the one to help you succeed
 His background?

Before joining Qonto, J√©r√©mie was an associate professor at Telecom Paris and Telecom SudParis. He led data teams for some of France's most reputed digital companies and still advises several deep tech startups. He teaches at Ecole Polytechnique and co-authored over 50 scientific papers.
 What does he bring to the team?

J√©r√©mie defines a clear vision and path to success for our data platform, BI, data science analytics, and data products teams. He ensures they operate efficiently and have a smooth collaboration with other departments at Qonto. He also helps them continuously learn new skills while improving their existing ones and is still very involved in the hiring of his teams.

üèÖ About You
 Management: You have a few years of experience in managing teams of Data and Analytics Engineers Mastery: You are familiar with data pipeline tools (airflow, dbt, etc.), modern data architectures, and data governance processes Simplicity and quality: You prefer simple solutions and are obsessed with quality Languages: You are fluent in English. French is a plus.

If you read this far and feel like this could be a great opportunity for you, don't let the imposter syndrome prevent you from applying and hit the button "Apply", we'd really love to hear from you

At Qonto we understand that true diversity isn't just about ticking boxes on a hiring checklist. Apply regardless of the boxes you tick! Who knows? You may have the missing piece of the puzzle we've been searching for all along.

üéÅ Perks 

A laptop. An inclusive work environment. A tailor-made career track. And so much more to help you succeed‚Ä¶
 A central fully-renovated building in Barcelona with WeWork services Monthly team events Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for 23 days of paid leave + 5 additional days of paid leave Alan ( Seguro ) health insurance, Moka Care to take care of your mental health and gym access with Urban Sports Club An Edenred lunch card: 100% covered 50% public transportation reimbursementA progressive parenthood policy as part of our commitment to the Parental Act (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners

üí™ Our hiring process:
 Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like

We will send you an interview guide so you can best prepare yourself.

On average our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within 48 hours ü§û

Thank you for considering joining Qonto. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

One last thing. We recently raised  486M‚Ç¨ in our Series D  to ensure we keep growing safely, despite the current economic environment looking a bit gloomy. We revealed our plans for the future  here .

To learn more about us:

Qonto's Blog | Business Insider | Metropoli Abierta | Europa Press

title: DATA SCIENCE CONSULTANT BARCELONA
description:
You will be working in key projects for leading organizations in data mining & knowledge Discovery, predictive modeling, trend modeling, Simulation models (Monte Carlo), Review of credit rating and scoring models and quant support to the business and R&D projects.
Requirements
 Recent graduates or final year students from disciplines relating to Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Econometrics or other Quantitative fields. A Master's degree qualification will be taken into account when determining salary conditions. Postgraduate studies and/or specialised courses are an asset, especially in Data Science, Quantitative Finance or similar.  Should desirably have knowledge of modeling techniques (logit, GLM, time series, decision trees, random forests, clustering), statistical programming languages (SAS, R, Python, Matlab) and big data tools and platforms (Hadoop, Hive, etc.).  Solid academic record.  Strong computer skills.  Knowledge of other languages is desirable.  Get-up-and-go attitude, maturity, responsibility and strong work ethic.  Strong ability to learn quickly.  Able to integrate easily into multidisciplinary teams. 
We Offer
The best environment to develop talent
We offer you the possibility to join a firm that provides all you need to develop your talent to the fullest:
Working in the highest-profile consulting projects in the industry,for the largest companies, leaders of their respective markets,alongside top industry management as they face challenges at the national and global level,as part of an extraordinary team of professionals whose values and corporate culture are a benchmark for the industry
Ongoing training plan, with approximately 10% of business turnover spent in training
 600 hours of training during the first two years. Specialist knowledge courses, external expert courses, professional skills courses and language courses.Last year our staff as a whole received over 280,000 hours of training spanning more than 700 courses.Every new joiner is enrolled in our degree in Business Consulting Management Solutions-ICADE Business School, offering a specialization in Big data and Data Science for professionals with a technological or mathematical background.
Clearly defined career plan
 Internal promotion based solely on merit. Partnership-based management model offers all professionals the opportunity to become part of the Firm‚Äôs group of partners.
Complementary experiencies
University: we maintain a close relationship with the world‚Äôs most prestigious universities.Social Action: we organize more than 30 community support activities. Sports Club: internal and external tournaments.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Get to know us
Do you want to help us shape what the future of work will look like and how it will best embrace our life's aspirations? If this sounds like a journey you want to embark on, we may have the right role for you!
PayFit is an intuitive cloud-based payroll and employee management solution designed specifically for SMBs. Since 2015, we have set ourselves a mission to simplify payroll for SMBs and enable employers and employees to grow together. We are a European company operating from 3 main countries (France, Spain, and the UK) where we are supporting over 9500 clients.
Creating a Fulfilling Work Environment And Culture Is Also a Core Mission At PayFit, And Our Day-to-day Work Philosophy Is Reflected In Our Four Values
Care 
We genuinely care for others whoever they are, whatever they think
Excellence 
We aim to improve and achieve better results every day
Humility 
Staying humble and exchanging transparent feedback helps us to grow and improve
Passion 
We are the architects of PayFit¬¥s success
A key part of our culture, and essential for our success, is also improving the diversity of our teams and building an inclusive culture where you can be yourself at work.
This is why our recruitment focuses on the skills you demonstrate, and not only on your academic background or previous professional experiences. At PayFit we understand that you can gain applicable skills through a variety of life experiences and we are interested in knowing them, too.
About The Role
Get onboard of the PayFit rocket by joining our Data tribe composed of 4 teams : BI, Product Data Analytics, Analytics Engineering and Data Engineering.
This Senior Data Analyst role is part of BI team, where you will have a specific focus on CS (Customer Success) team needs, and will also be working on transversal projects that will impact all PayFit !
You Will Be Responsible For
 Working closely with the Head of Data and the CS Teams to identify problems, implementing solutions based on data and defining key success metrics Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights Designing and implementing data models to support analysis and reporting needs Creating visually appealing and interactive dashboards, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders Ensuring data accuracy, completeness, and reliability through data cleansing, validation, and governance techniques Proficiently managing and querying large databases, optimizing performance and efficiency Translating business requirements into actionable insights and presenting analysis results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop data strategies and make data-driven recommendations for strategic decision-making Applying advanced analytics techniques such as predictive modeling, machine learning, and data mining
This Role Is For You If
 You have 4+ years of experience in an analytical role You have a strong logic & business sense You are autonomous, self-starter, detail-oriented You are proactive, and have a problem-solving mindset You have strong communication skills You have strong analytical & data driven skills You have 3+ years working experience with SQL and data visualization tools You are fluent in English
It Would Be Great If Also
 You have experience with Looker You have experience with dbt You are familiar with a scripting language (Preferred: Python) You have experience with CS Analytics
If you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we would love to hear from you!
Your Future Team
Together with your BI team members (2 Data Analysts), you will enable Analytics Engineers to develop metrics and will collaborate closely with key business stakeholders across PayFit.
Hiring Process
At PayFit, everyone will be given the same chance. To do so, here are the steps of the process :
 First you will meet a Talent Acquisition Specialist for a discovery call (30 min)
2 . Next step will be a meeting  with Aida , Head of Data, (45 min)
 You will then meet 2 Data Analysts : Tiago & Carla (60 min)
4 . You will meet Fran√ßois, Business stakeholder (45 min)
 The last step would be having a discussion with Sylvain, CPO (45 min)
What We Offer
Flexibility: We believe that to produce your best work and to be fulfilled, you should be free to choose what working arrangements suit you best. You can work from any place within Spain with the possibility to work abroad for some period of time.
Learning & Development: At PayFit we have a great learning platform where you can learn new skills every day with the support of our company. We also have English language courses to improve your business communication vocabulary and get to the next level.
Career Development: We want you to progress and be free to choose which direction you want to grow. There are also opportunities for internal moves.
Health promotion: Gym subscription (AndJoy) with a preferential rate.
Meals: 6 EUR lunch voucher per workday with our partner Edenred.
Transportation: 50 % of public transport card covered by PayFit .
Health Insurance: Full coverage on private insurance with Sanitas.
Parental support program: Support with a nursery for your child.
Home office budget to help you get set up in the best conditions. A MacBook as our standard working tool.
Time off: 25 days of holidays per year.
Disability Inclusion: All of our positions are open to any person living with a disability. To guarantee equal treatment and opportunities, we will take, based on individual needs, appropriate measures to adapt the work conditions of PayFiters with disabilities, and if needed also during the recruitment process.

title: Financial Data Analyst
description:
Americold provides temperature-controlled warehousing and transportation to food producers, restaurants, schools and retail outlets such as grocery stores. We're proud to provide an essential link in the food industry supply chain and to help put food on tables around the world.
Based in Atlanta, Georgia, Americold owns and operates temperature-controlled warehouses around the world. We have over 16,000 associates and offer a wide variety of career opportunities - from warehouse forklift operators and supervisors to accounting, administration, business development, customer support, engineering, transportation, and technology solutions positions.
Qualifications
 Qualifications & Experience: 
 Education, Training & Professional Experience: 
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Economics, or Mathematics. MBA and/or certifications a plus. 3 - 5 years in financial analysis, pricing, or a logistics-related role with experience in system transformations. Highly proficient computer skills in Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint, and Visio. Ability to work independently and take on ownership of projects. Experience in financial statement analysis and financial modeling. Experience with Customer Relationship Management tools (Salesforce, etc) strongly preferred. 
Knowledge & Employment Standards:
Proven problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively and strategically. Proven ability to communicate and present complex data in a persuasive and consultative manner- both written and verbal. Inherent strength in project management to meet aggressive deadlines. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment of positively changing expectations and culture. Must be naturally curious in nature and interested in finding the perfect solution to difficult problemsMust enjoy discussing and/or documenting project scope, approaches and status updatesMust be business savvy, possess financial acumen and demonstrate excellent communication skills both written and verbal. 
Responsibilities
Kindly be aware that this position is project-oriented, and a one-year contract will be provided.
Primary Responsibility:
Support project ORION (ERP Transformation) in harnessing data elements needed in centralized location to enable faster transition to new ERP, billing platform and Salesforce.com. Provide regular updates to key business information related to customer level metrics and data including, but not limited to, Customer profile, customer rates, customer revenue/billing, market intelligence, competitor data/information, etc..
Essential Functions:
Work with cross functional teams (Engineering, IT, FP&A, PMO, Transport, etc.) to build detailed KPI‚Äôs/metrics reporting to enable a better understanding of the business. Provide regular reporting on customer level data to primarily European central finance teams. Provide insights to enable data standardization across sites on key metrics. Act as Commercial Finance product owner in reporting system transformation projectOther duties and ad hoc analysis as requested.  The role requires a maximum of 40% travel.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Helping ideas grow
En FI Group ayudamos a peque√±as y grandes empresas a desarrollar sus ideas innovadoras a trav√©s de la obtenci√≥n de incentivos fiscales y ayudas a nivel nacional e internacional. Apostamos por la I+D+i como base para la creaci√≥n de compa√±√≠as m√°s competitivas que aporten soluciones para cambiar el presente y mejorar el futuro de nuestra sociedad.
¬øPor qu√© trabajar con nosotros?
Nuestro mayor valor son las personas que conforman FI Group. Simpat√≠a, cercan√≠a, profesionalidad y agilidad son las se√±as de identidad de nuestro equipo humano.
