title: Director of Data
description:
Director of Data

Are you an experienced data expert looking to guide a thriving Barcelona based start up by leading a mix of data teams to establish, refine, and revolutionise their data systems?

This is an incredible opportunity for an ambitious, driven data analyst, engineer, or scientist to take the next step in your career and step into higher leadership at the fastest growing delivery player in Europe, Central Asia, and Africa. In 2022 alone, this company received 10 million orders across 260,000 partners, they have exploded into the market and are set to grow exponentially into 2023, offering a wealth of opportunity for the future.

Position Overview:

You will lead five teams of data engineers, data scientists, and product & data analysts to make the marketplace a personal, data driven environment. This company generates value from user behaviour data and are acutely aware of the value of their data teams.

Key Responsibilities:

You will prioritise the scope, staff, and safeguarding of vital projects across the company's business with board-level visibility.You will be a leading voice on road maps, knowing the right balance to deliver reliable whilst maintaining a good balance of speed and quality.You will be a voice for innovation in an environment that values your ability to deliver insights and automated decision support across customer and partner-facing apps.You will be hands on with innovative technologies such as Generative AI and will ensure continuous learning through experimentation at scale.Cultivate a thriving culture of ownership, innovation, and mastery of purpose within your teams to drive a data-driven culture across the company.Requirements:

You will have hands on experience as either a data scientist, engineer, or analyst and will be educated on the most recent developments in these areas, with this company's data stack being AWS, Python, Spark, Trino/Starburst, DBT, Looker and Amplitude among others.Must bring leadership experience of guiding teams of 5-7 experts in an agile environment, with the confidence to take this further.Must be experienced in guiding multi-craft teams to deliver production-ready data pipelines and data science models and company-wide insights. Influenced both product and business stakeholders on Director level (and above) MS/BS in quantitative field/ Experience in marketplace dynamics and how data can impact platform or e-commerce business is a plus.Must be experienced delivering impactful data products fast with attention to detail, the ability to look at solutions in creative and unconventional ways, recognise opportunities to innovate and engage stakeholders in vision and strategy.If you are interested in the opportunity to champion data processes whilst leading a series of teams to success at a thriving leader in the Food Delivery marketplace, please apply by submitting your CV through this advertisement.

title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
description:
Job description:

We are looking for a talented and motivated colleague to join our team in the Global Commercial Excellence department of ZF Aftermarket near district 22 in Barcelona (Districte de la innovaci√≥).

 

In this role, you will be responsible for developing and implementing strategies to drive revenue growth, improve market share, and enhance customer satisfaction. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop and execute go-to-market plans, identify new business opportunities, and optimize pricing and product offerings.

The aftermarket environment is undergoing a massive shift in electrified, connected, intelligent, and shared mobility. At ZF, we are looking for talented professionals who are passionate about data-driven innovation and eager to help shape the future of the automotive industry. If you are a driven, curious, and dedicated professional looking to join a dynamic and innovative team. Join ZF and be part of a team that is at the forefront of automotive innovation!

 

Your tasks:

 Prototype advanced analytics data products (models for business recommendations, segmentations, optimizations & statistical forecasts) across marketing, sales, pricing & logistics. In order to create the relevant algorithms which can improve how the business operates ‚Äì the data scientists follow a series of steps. This cycle represents the data scientist responsibilities:  Business Understanding - acquire understanding of the business problem with the help of business analyst, by asking the right questions. Data Understanding ‚Äì Lead the exploration of the data. In order to acquire knowledge which will contribute to the success of the models. Modelling ‚Äì Create hypothesis of which models could fit the data, test the different hypothesis, find optimal parameters. Results ‚Äì data scientist will share prototype results and get feedback to have its model improved. Cycle will be repeated until the maturity is enough to be accepted for business use.    

Your profile:

 Strong background in Computing and Statistics (academical and/or from experience). min. 2 years of professional experience with unsupervised and supervised models including tree-based models and linear models in Python, R & Pyspark. Experience with (Deep) Neural Networks and Bayesian modelling - desirable. Knowledge of databases (ex. Oracle, AWS S3). Knowledge of Big Data platforms (ex. Databricks, GCP, Cloudera). Willingness to work in a team, dealing with uncertainty and ambiguity, business acumen, communication (mostly data storytelling).  

The position is part of the ZF Global Employee Referral Program.

title: Data Acquisition Strategist (m/f/d)
description:
Job description:

We are looking for a new colleague in the Global Commercial Excellence department of ZF Aftermarket at our location in Barcelona (or District 22, Barcelona).


Your tasks:

 Interface with BI, IT and other excellence departments to manage the sourcing of data for advanced analytics purpose. This could be internal data (product data, transactional data, online, etc.) and external data (i.e. market data, IoT data) for the usage of advanced analytics Leverage a network of stakeholders and external providers to create business cases for new datasets/technologies which could generate new insights and detect business opportunities enhancing commercial excellence and targeted selling Escalate data pipeline/quality issues Share the knowledge about the best data sources for the different analytical needs Monitor the quality and ensure coherence of the data of the outputs in the different endpoints (CRM, Pricing System, ERP systems, Digital Channels, Dashboards).  

Your profile:

 Experience in Mobility Aftermarket (or similar business) - preferred. Strong knowledge of advanced analytics use cases, which methodologies exist and what they can be used for Proficient in Databases (ex. Oracle, AWS S3), ETL tools (ex. Talend), Big Data platforms (ex. Databricks) Knowledge on the data structures from ERP systems (ex. SAP) - desirable Proficiency in data visualization tools such as tableau, knowledge of technologies to manage project tasks and risks (ex. JIRA, MS project, etc.) ‚Äì desirable Excellent communication skills in English, both written and oral.  

The position is part of the ZF Global Employee Referral Program.

title: Staff Data Analyst
description:
Staff Data Analyst translates data into insights and supports data-driven decisions in order to help the organization reach it's targets. Helps identifying missed and new opportunities, supports decision-making process, establishes best practices in the way data is used in his department. Staff Data Analyst achieves this through high business acumen, close relations with stakeholders and peers, relevant statistical methods including advanced techniques and top-notch data fluency.

Key Responsibilities 

Data Analysis: Connect, explore and analyse large and complex datasets to identify trends, patterns and actionable insights. This involves utilizing statistical techniques and data mining methods to extract meaningful information from the data.Reporting and Visualization: Support your findings and recommendations with clear reports, dashboards and visualizations. Present complex topics in an easy-to-understand ways, fit to the needs of the audience.Data Modeling and Forecasting: Develop and maintain statistical models for products or processes to forecast future business performance.Leadership and Cooperation: Lead cross-department and cross-functional projects from definition to deployment. Be proactive in identification of business opportunities and proposing effective solutions.Innovation and Mentoring: Cultivate culture of innovation in the Data Analytics area. Be role model and go-to person for advanced analytical topics. Mentor less senior colleagues and improve the maturity of Data Analytics area.Tools and Technologies: Utilize various data analysis tools and technologies, such as SQL, Python, R, or data visualization tools, to manipulate and analyse data effectively. Stay up to date with emerging tools and technologies in the field of data analysis.

Technical/Professional qualification 

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business economics, mathematics, statistics or a related field.Experience in business intelligence or data analytics, analysing data through statistical, quantitative modeling/forecasting methods.Expert SQL knowledge, experience with data visualisation tools (such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI...).Track record of generated actionable recommendations and impact on the organization

Personal/Leadership Skills 

Effective communication of complex technical concepts and analytical findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholdersAbility to build strong interpersonal relationships with co-workers at all levels.Stakeholder management and prioritisation skills.Clear and concise communication, ability to simplify the complex and help all stakeholders understand important information.Critical thinking for 360 view on the task at handProblem solving to tackle complex problems with just the right approach and innovation wherever necessaryAbility to work in a fast-paced, constantly changing and evolving environment. Comfortable with ambiguity.

 We offer you 

The opportunity to join our Phantom Stock scheme.We give our employees a freedom to choose between the environment of work from home and our modern office located in the centric neighbourhood (Passeig de Gr√†cia) in Cloudworks coworking space where you can enjoy Kiwi.com ‚Äôs private office space, two common terraces with great views, common coworking activities (yoga, games, etc.), free refreshments and shower.We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days, sick days, private medical insurance, Employee Assistance Program, GymForLess membership, the annual subscription for El Bicing. Flight vouchers to celebrate your kiwi anniversaries.The latest version of Hardware from Apple or Microsoft based on your preferences.We offer unlimited contracts within a forward-thinking and ambitious company.Relocation package (including visa transfer support).Dogs and parties are welcome in our offices.
Interested? Join us and hack the traditional ways of travel!

Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it‚Äôs finished, we‚Äôre going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/ .

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
Contentsquare is a global digital analytics company empowering the brands you interact with every day to build better online experiences for all. Since our founding in France in 2012, we have grown to be a truly global and distributed team ‚Äì known as the CSquad ‚Äì representing more than 70 nationalities across the world.
In 2022, we raised $600M in Series F funding and were recognised as a certified Great Place to Work in France, Germany, Israel, US and UK.
What you will do:
Measurement and Reporting:
 Develop a measurement strategy for marketing campaigns Build reports and visualizations with marketing key metrics to help the team understand campaign effectiveness Conduct deep dive analysis to identify drivers of marketing performance and generate insights for future campaigns Should be able to quickly digest or develop a new KPI, ask the right questions, and effectively interpret and act on what it's telling you and what it's not telling you. Monitor marketing KPIs and explain deviations from the norm Deliver sophisticated analyses to senior leadership that provide thoughtful evaluation of data Partner with the Growth & Performance team to analyze CAC/LTV Proactively identify opportunities to automate reporting and data collection processes Collaborate with internal teams to gather benchmark data and other insights for marketing campaigns
Data Analysis:
 Use statistical tools and methods to analyze data from various sources Automate analysis through insightful dashboards Communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner Continuously monitor data quality
What You Need To Succeed
Qualifications:
 Bachelor's degree in a related field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or Engineering Experience 3+ years in Data Analysis in a Tech Company extracting insights from data to inform decision making, and a strong understanding of interplays of different acquisition marketing channels Fluent professional English
Technical Skills:
 Strong SQL skills, knowledge of DBT is a plus Strong skills in Data Visualization tools, Tableau is a plus Experience with ELT tools Expert proficiency with Excel/Gsheets Familiarity with Hubspot, Salesforce, Google Analytics, and other MarTech Python knowledge is a plus
Soft Skills:
 Excellent organizational, project and time management, communication, and presentation skills Self-starter who is comfortable setting the agenda and owning follow through with minimal oversight Proven attention to detail Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively Strong understanding of statistical analysis and modeling Can work fast and handle tight deadlines
‚Ç¨50,000 - ‚Ç¨60,000 a year
Why you should join Contentsquare:
‚ñ™Ô∏è We‚Äôre humans first. We hire dedicated people and provide them with the trust, resources and flexibility to get the job done.
‚ñ™Ô∏è We invest in our people through career development, mentorship, social events, philanthropic activities, and competitive benefits.
‚ñ™Ô∏è We are a fast growing company with a track record of success over the past 10 years, yet we operate with the agility of a startup. That means a huge chance to create an immediate and lasting impact.
‚ñ™Ô∏è Our clients, partners and investors love our industry-leading product.
To keep our employees happy and engaged, we are always assessing the benefits/perks we offer to ensure we are competitive. Here are a few we want to highlight:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Virtual onboarding, Hackathon, and various opportunities to interact with your team and global colleagues both on and offsite each year.
‚ñ™Ô∏è Work flexibility: hybrid and remote work policies.
‚ñ™Ô∏è Generous paid time-off policy (every location is different).
‚ñ™Ô∏è Immediate eligibility for birthing and non-birthing parental leave.
‚ñ™Ô∏è Wellbeing allowance.
‚ñ™Ô∏è Home Office Allowance.
‚ñ™Ô∏è A Culture Crew in every country to coordinate regular outings such as game nights, movie nights, and happy hours.
‚ñ™Ô∏è Every full-time employee receives stock options, allowing them to share in the company‚Äôs success.
‚ñ™Ô∏è We offer many benefits in various countries -- ask your recruiter for more information.
Uniqueness is embedded in our DNA as one of our core values. Even if you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements above, we encourage you to apply.
We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer ‚Äì we commit to responding to every applicant
Contentsquare is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Your personal data is used by Contentsquare for recruitment purposes only. Read our Job Candidate Privacy Notice to find out more about data protection at Contentsquare and your rights.

title: Azure Data Consultant
description:

title: Data Scientist (Andorra)
description:
At Gauss & Neumann, we are looking for PhDs, MSc and BS mathematics, physics and engineering to work with us in our office in Andorra. We do Search Engine Marketing (SEM) worldwide and work for international clients. We love and breath technology and everyone at the company has a tech background. 
We believe that advertising on search engines (SEM) should provide perfect answers to the users. Gauss & Neumann creates data structures and technologies that help our clients deliver a perfect response to queries and provide value to search engine customers like Google or Bing. 
What we look for: Professionals with a PhD, MSc or bachelor degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other engineering disciplines. We search for natural problem solvers with initiative that push the needle always a bit further and have the self-discipline to get things done. We look for people that have fun at work and create a great atmosphere with their teammates. We value personal attitude at the very top. 
Responsibilities: Design SEM keyword structures for international clients Create predictive algorithms for bidding in real time Create scripts for optimizing keyword structures Create technologies that disrupt the SEM industry Data research and visualization Manage campaign daily operations with large clients mainly in the United States. 
What you need to have:Bachelor, MSc or PhD level degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or Software Engineering or similar engineering degree. Programming skills (Python, SQL, PHP, R...). Statistics knowledge 
Other skills we value:English fluency (written and verbal) Project management experience Natural ability to deal with ratios and numbers Being up to date with programming libraries Willingness to learn and go beyond what's necessary. 
Why joining Gauss & Neumann: Gauss & Neumann provides an open environment of excellence with some of the best SEM professionals in the advertising industry. Most of our staff holds a PhD in Mathematics or Physics. G&N open culture provides unlimited vacation time, total daily autonomy, private insurance and the ability to run your own projects and take relevant decisions within the company. 
Location: Our new office is right in the heart of the capital of Andorra, in the main shopping area in the center, with stunning views of the mountains and in a natural environment. Ideal for those who love outdoors and work surrounded by nature.

title: Senior Data Analyst - Growth (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are looking for a world-class Sr Growth Analyst to become part of our Regional team. Are you able to translate data into actionable insights? Are you looking for a challenging experience in the fast and rapidly changing environment helping to build a product that will disrupt the On-demand market? If your answer is YES we are looking forward to meeting you.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisionsDrive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actionsIdentify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitabilityTake ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available onesEnsure these tools are scalable and up-to-dateAssist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data
You Have
3-4 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actionsNinja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a mustSQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plusKnowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker or Qlikview is a plusMust have strong business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation).Hands-on attitude is a must. You‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!Proficiency in English is a must
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing equity plan (if applicable)Private health insuranceMonthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!Discounted gym membershipsFlexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)Online therapy and wellbeing benefit
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quicklyGood Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: Software Engineer (Data Engineer)
description:
31682BR
Role Responsibilities
Your responsibilities as a data engineer will be centred around ingesting and managing data our customers rely on. Your tasks will span from designing efficient, automated ETL/ELT processes to deploying the infrastructure to run them, as well as maintaining existing applications, and exploring new technologies that can support our analytics pipeline. More specifically you will focus on:
Designing and maintaining robust and scalable data processes.Handle the data lifecycle of different data sources across the organization.Being pivotal on data-driven decisions within the data team and across the organisation.Your profile
BS/MS degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering or a related subject;2+ years experience as a data engineer or related;Proficiency regarding data models and databases internals;Experience managing large amounts of structured/unstructured data;3+ years of development experience in PythonExperience with relational databases (E.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL databases (E.g. MongoDB, DocumentDB).Familiarity with the AWS ecosystem;A passion for data quality and clean, documented code;Experience with agile practices;Eager to continuously bring in innovation by exploring new methods and technologiesGood communication skills with the ability to discuss clearly complex topicsAbility to provide direction and mentoring to junior profilesFluent in English (spoken and written).
Qualifications
You stand out if
Have experience with dbt;Have experience building APIs in Python;Have experience with orchestration tools like Airflow;Have experience with data lakes and data warehouses;Have experience with BigData tools like Kafka, Spark, etc.;You are familiar with event-driven architecture.
CRE Moody's Analytics provides a data driven analytics platform which supports agile investment teams, asset / portfolio managers, banks and brokers. Our SaaS solution offers vertical business intelligence, atomised rent roll analysis, and market analytics applying state-of-the-art big data and AI technologies. The platform makes holistic market data instantly accessible, creates transparency and thereby digitises the industry.
Be part of our journey! We are looking for a self-driven and passionate developer to join our tech team
Moody‚Äôs is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.
Moody‚Äôs is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don‚Äôt meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.
Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.
At Moody‚Äôs, we‚Äôre taking action. We‚Äôre hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We‚Äôre educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

title: Data Scientist (Product Analytics) ESP
description:
At Teladoc Health, we‚Äôre transforming the lives of people through whole person virtual care. You‚Äôll have the benefit to positively impact the lives of hundreds of thousands (soon millions!) of people through personalized interventions to the right person at the right time.
As a Data Scientist, Product Analytics your main focus will be to measure member experience and guide product decisions, ultimately making Teladoc Health‚Äôs products more valuable, delightful and intuitive to our Members. We‚Äôre looking for someone with at least 2 years of experience in Data Analytics. In addition to technical data science skills, core competencies such as collaboration, decision-making, communication and flexibility will be key to your success.
This role offers the challenge and excitement of converting data analysis into real-life benefits. Come help us break new ground, while measurably improving lives and saving millions in healthcare costs.
Role and Responsibilities:-Provide insights about our products and member experience to inform Product teams for roadmap and feature decisions.-Conduct exploratory analysis and develop statistical models to answer key product usage and engagement questions.-Help Product and Marketing teams use experimentation (A/B testing) and cohorting to test assumptions and launch new marketing campaigns, features and product releases.-Partner with Product teams to define and benchmark metrics for new features launches and initiatives and help create a culture of measurement.
Requirements:-Strong experience with SQL, Power BI, and either R or Python. Expected to write good quality, 3+ years of work experience in product/data analytics or a related discipline.-Data science experience (SQL, Python, R) and familiarity with managing large data sets.-A general knowledge of machine learning approaches is a plus.-The ability to collaborate and communicate with Product Managers and help them craft hypotheses, and define and measure KPIs.-Confidence working with ambiguity, unknown variables, and missing context (and the ability to find ways to bridge those gaps when necessary).-A self-starter approach, with strong motivation and drive for excellence.-BS degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related filed in lieu of degree, relevant work experience and/or trade school.

For a more detailed look at our company and values, visit our website at https://www.teladochealth.com/
At Teladoc Health we thrive on difference and individuality. Teladoc Health is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

title: Senior marketing Data Analyst
description: En los √∫ltimos a√±os todo ha cambiado mucho, pero las marcas siguen persiguiendo lo mismo de siempre: llegar a las audiencias y conectar con ellas de forma eficaz. Lo que con la televisi√≥n era relativamente sencillo, ahora se ha vuelto m√°s complejo que nunca.Hemos pasado de un ecosistema basado en medios masivos a un ecosistema fragmentado donde las audiencias est√°n cada vez m√°s atomizadas y donde es m√°s dif√≠cil que nunca captar la atenci√≥n y ser relevante. As√≠ como esta transformaci√≥n implica un cambio de mentalidad en el enfoque creativo y estrat√©gico de la comunicaci√≥n, tambi√©n supone una nueva manera de entender la medici√≥n y el impacto de la efectividad publicitaria. Integrar datos de diferentes plataformas, trabajar con creadores de contenido, saber qu√© se est√° diciendo de tu marca en RRSS, medir la efectividad del contenido y no solo de spots, entender la atenci√≥n en cada canal‚Ä¶ Nuestro cliente lleva a√±os defendiendo un modelo de medici√≥n que responda a este nuevo contexto. Es por eso que busca a alguien como t√∫. Un/a Senior Marketing Data Analyst que les ayude a hacer crecer el negocio de sus clientes a trav√©s de los datos.  FUNCIONESRecopilaci√≥n y an√°lisis de datos: Recopilar datos relacionados con las actividades de comunicaci√≥n de la agencia, como campa√±as publicitarias, social listening, post tests de campa√±a, indicadores de salud de marca. Luego, analizar estos datos utilizando herramientas y t√©cnicas estad√≠sticas para obtener informaci√≥n significativa. Identificaci√≥n de patrones y tendencias: Examinar los datos recopilados para identificar patrones, tendencias y relaciones. Realizar an√°lisis de comportamiento de la audiencia y an√°lisis de rendimiento de campa√±as para comprender mejor el impacto de las estrategias de comunicaci√≥n. Generaci√≥n de informes y visualizaci√≥n de datos: Comunicar los hallazgos y las conclusiones a trav√©s de informes y visualizaciones de datos claros y comprensibles utilizando herramientas de visualizaci√≥n de datos para crear gr√°ficos, tablas y dashboards que faciliten la interpretaci√≥n de los resultados. Evaluaci√≥n de la efectividad: Medir el rendimiento de las actividades de comunicaci√≥n, el rendimiento de las campa√±as, el impacto en la marca y el efecto en las ventas. Esta evaluaci√≥n ayuda a identificar qu√© estrategias y t√°cticas son exitosas y cu√°les deben ser ajustadas o modificadas. Optimizaci√≥n de estrategias de marketing: Utilizando los datos recopilados y los hallazgos obtenidos, colabora con el cliente y con el equipo interno de la agencia, especialmente departamento de cuentas, creativo, estrategia y de medios, para optimizar las estrategias y t√°cticas. Presentaci√≥n de Resultados:Una vez se han sacado conclusiones explicaras los resultados y las conclusiones al cliente para poder tomar acciones que permitan mejorar la estrategia de comunicaci√≥n.  REQUISITOS Y HABILIDADESPara poder llevar a cabo tus funciones de manera √≥ptima, es necesario que cuentes con las siguientes habilidades: ¬∑ Licenciatura o grado relacionado con marketing, publicidad o an√°lisis de datos¬∑ Conocimiento de aplicaciones como de Data Analysis, Machine Learning, SQL, estad√≠sticas: definir cu√°les¬∑ Capacidad anal√≠tica¬∑ Visi√≥n estrat√©gica¬∑ Conocimientos relacionados con marketing y comunicaci√≥n¬∑ Conocimientos relacionados con medios pagados¬∑ Predisposici√≥n buena para trabajar sobre objetivos a largo plazo¬∑ Capacidad de comunicaci√≥n oral y escrita   ¬øQU√â OFRECEMOS?Ambiente de trabajo incre√≠ble, hacen todo lo posible para ser felices, la certificaci√≥n Great Place to Work¬© que han obtenido los avala (Se trata de uno de los reconocimientos m√°s prestigiosos en el √°mbito de la gesti√≥n de personas y la estrategia de negocio tanto a nivel nacional como internacional que se otorga anualmente a los mejores empleadores del mundo). Beneficios sociales:BS: 35-40kPorque creemos en el talento y su desarrollo, la formaci√≥n est√° muy presente: ofrecen desde capacitaci√≥n t√©cnica al desarrollo de competencias.Retribuci√≥n flexible (restaurante, guarder√≠a, transporte, formaci√≥n y salud) que te puede suponer un ahorro aproximado del 30% de lo invertido en estos servicios/productos.Acceso a una amplia red de gimnasios /centros de yoga con cuota subvencionada.Acceso al conocimiento (todo tipo de formaciones para el desarrollo personal y profesional, sesiones de inspiraci√≥n).

title: Supply Chain Data Analytics
description:
PURPOSE 
As member of a global Center of Expertise (CoE) organization within the GBS the incumbent is supporting the operational teams to increase effectiveness and efficiency in the area of global supply planning, intercompany order management and product change management by process optimization and automation in close alignment with Local and Global Process Managers.
 Scope:  Global SCM organizations and SMEs for SCM functions in various global locations. Job position located in Sant Joan Desp√≠ (Barcelona).
Your Tasks & Responsabilities
 Create and maintain reporting of operational GSM KPIs and reports to support operational processes. Provide transparency on process adherence and quality. Perform ad-hoc data analysis and identify improvement potentials. Identify/document use cases for analytics and automation and create prototypes. Continuous improvement of current tools. Act as a GSM Hub ambassador to Global functions within Product Supply. Lead local projects/initiatives and contribute to global projects. Actively drive projects E2E.
 Key working relations: 
 Global Process Owners/Global Process Managers SMEs for Supply Chain Processes GSM Hub & RSCM Hub Operations teams GSM Process & Analytics Intelligent Automation IT Enabling Functions Quality SC Development
Who You Are
 Bachelor or master in SCM, Business Administration, IT or equivalent education. Good knowledge of Supply chain planning and execution processes. Business process oriented with analytic mindset. Proactive and analytical approach, solution oriented with the ability to solve simplify and harmonize processes. Good knowledge in building data models, analyzing datasets (SQL, Power Query) and building reports/dashboards (Power BI, tableau). Good knowledge in MS Office, SAP BW, APO and ERP. Desired: Knowledge on OMP and SAP HANNA. Proven digital acumen, experience in data analytics and process automation. Good communication skills and relationship management capabilities. Strong ability to prioritize and manage complex tasks. Flexibility to travel occasionally. Fluent in English.
 YOUR APPLICATION 
This is your opportunity to tackle the world‚Äôs biggest challenges with us: Maintaining our health, feeding growing populations and slowing the rate of climate change. You have a voice, ideas and perspectives and we want to hear them. Because our success begins with you. Be part of something big. Be Bayer.
Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.

title: Associate Project Manager Data Analyst (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

As an Associate Project Manager Data Analyst, you will learn and acquire capabilities on how to prioritize, plan, execute, monitor, control and close projects with the aim to improve the performance of thousands of Partners who use Glovo, globally. You will be defining projects from definition to closure, even defining the best processes for every case. We are seeking a very hands-on and analytical person who has an interest and knowledge about the project management topic and that wants to grow in that area in a company that provides a massive opportunity of facing new projects every single day.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Be proactive and hands-on in understanding partner challenges and find standardization solutions that can create scale impact Coordinate with multiple stakeholders across various Glovo operating countries, Product tech and operations teams Ensure strong collaboration and communication across the company and serve as a primary point of contact for internal stakeholders Analyzing, planning and developing scheduled projects to improve Partner performance while building and providing tools to help regional and country Partner Operations teams to drive improvements Determining and defining clear deliverables and responsibilities Perform risk management to minimize project risks Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation Proactive and positive in identifying opportunities and working on them with minimal management oversight Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference 
You Have
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business - Project Management / Engineering or related field 1-2 years of experience in operations or managing projects Proven track record of process improvement Proven experience improving performance and making data driven decisions Demonstrated data analysis experience and high proficiency with Excel is a must, good knowledge of SQL Worked in a fast-paced environment and enjoy providing insights that will help evolve existing project and define new ones Highly motivated and results-driven A high level of proficiency in English An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude 
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing equity plan (if applicable) Top-notch private health insurance Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Discounted gym memberships Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time) Enhanced parental leave including nursery support! Online therapy and wellbeing benefit 
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning Care: Uplift people and the planet Glownership: Act as proud owners High Bar: Focus on Top Performance 
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: Online Data Analyst
description:
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com
We are hiring freelance English and Spanish speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.
RequirementsFull Professional Proficiency in English and SpanishYou must be living in Spain for the last 2 consecutive yearsAbility to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website informationYou must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in SpainBeing open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance)Applicants must be 18 years or over.
Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.
Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?Earn extra incomeAccess to our community wellbeing initiativeRemote work & Location IndependenceBe your own bossFlexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyleBe a part of an online communityIf you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us at sourcingteam89@telusinternational.ai

title: SI Data Optimization Analyst, Remote Spain
description:
Hotelbeds is the world‚Äôs leading technology partner, connecting and empowering the world of travel. We‚Äôre game-changers, disruptors, the people who bring together local and global brands in accommodation, transport, activities and payments through our network of 300,000 hotels worldwide, 60,000 hard to reach high value clients such as tour operators, travel agents and loyalty schemes across 140 source markets. We are tech-driven, with a customer-first philosophy, and commercial teams whose knowledge and relationships on the ground are second to none. And of course we have an amazing team! Our people, Team Hotelbeds, are the beating heart of the company who we encourage to ‚Äòmove fast, dream big and make the difference‚Äô every day. In fact, we believe that it is tech + data + people that truly sets us apart in the market, alongside our ‚Äòglobal approach, local touch‚Äô mentality. We‚Äôre headquartered in Palma, Mallorca and employ around 3,500 people worldwide.
Job Summary
The SI Data Optimization Analyst is responsible for analyzing business KPIs combined with data from different processes involved in integrations with hospitality services suppliers (chains, bedbanks, platforms, etc) with the aim of finding opportunities to optimize these connectivities from both technical and business point of views. The main functions for this role will be to work closely together with Technical Account Managers focusing on analysis and providing recommendations to influence the way they optimize these connectivities. It will also provide a meaningful input to Product Management and Applied Science team to shape how critical initiatives are developed and delivered.The role combines strong technical background on data and analytics together with the understanding of business implications, working on implementing new solutions/tools and collaborating as a stakeholder with IT, Product Management, Applied Science, Technical Account Managers and Commercial teams.This role is an amazing opportunity to quickly learn how Hotelbeds business work in all its layers and have high visibility and exposure within the Hotelbeds eco-system interacting with a vast pool of stakeholders including top management.
Job Responsibilities:
Work on analysis to support the business data-driven decision making Investigate, propose, and validate potential improvements or upgrades in the optimization of certain processes with suppliersAnalyze, design, develop and automate the generation of certain reports to understand supplier performance Create customizable tools to improve efficiency of certain processesCrossing large volumes of data from different data sources with the goal to extract conclusions/opportunities and be able to share/present them. Development of ad-hoc scripts for hypothesis testing.
Required Skills:
Technical background / degree - computer science, or relatedKnowledge of python with at least 2y of experienceStrong analytical skills with a data driven mindsetExperience analyzing big data and extracting conclusions and actions from itKnowledge about RESTful APIs.Familiarity interpreting data/logs from XML/JSON/YAML formats and working with SQL databasesExperience interpreting metrics / KPIs, step back, connect the dots and proactively think on opportunities to improveStrong ability to understand business plans (commercial area) and their technical implicationsGood communication and interpersonal skills Proactive attitude and social skillsExperience using Microsoft office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook‚Ä¶)English professional proficiency. Strong written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to convey complex technical situations/conclusions to end users of all technical abilities, together with excellent presentation skills.Strong technical, logical, analytical, and problem-solving skillsTeam player with an agile mind-setCombine a tech and business view, in a good common senseManage priorities to perform highest impact actions firstAbility to multi-tasking, working under pressure and in highly changing environments

title: Data Scientist (BI & Reporting Team) ESP
description:
At Teladoc Health, we‚Äôre transforming the lives of people through whole person virtual care. You‚Äôll have the benefit to positively impact the lives of hundreds of thousands (soon millions!) of people through personalized interventions to the right person at the right time.
Come build the data and analytics tools that will help real people live measurably better lives. As a key part of our client analytics team, you‚Äôll work with cutting-edge data processing frameworks, technologies, and platforms to empower client-facing teams with the tools that enhance and reinforce Teladoc Health's value proposition. Your contributions will drive growth and client retention while providing a better way for Teladoc Health members to manage chronic health conditions.
Through data analytics, you‚Äôll discover and share insights about our members and clients to drive decision making. You‚Äôll work with SQL, Python, R, Jenkins, AWS Tech stack (Redshift, S3), Metabase and other technologies to design and build scalable and impactful reports, dashboards and visualizations. Collaborating closely with data scientists, engineers, PMs and clinical researchers, you‚Äôll help us transform the healthcare industry with innovative, highly effective products.
Your success in this role will be aided by strong data engineering skills and a knack for understanding business needs, especially from a reporting perspective. We‚Äôre looking for an effective team player who can facilitate complex, rapidly changing, high-volume data science needs with efficient data pipelines. Other key qualities for your success include attention to detail, pride in the quality of your data, a knack for solving real-life business problems, and a passion for helping people.
Role and Responsibilities:-Build automation tools, data pipelines that help us deliver quality reports on time for a multitude of requests.-Influence upstream system/design, definitions and develop scalable solutions to meet expectations from internal/external stakeholders.-Run ad-hoc data-extracts for requests from diverse partners and automate those needs over time.-Develop visualizations to tell stories effectively.-Build insightful dashboards, self-service tools and reports to slice/dice data for helping with partners in making strategic decisions for all functional areas such as member experience, product build/performance, clinical researches, business operations, growth/retention.-Engage with partners, internal and external stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of programs in a fast-paced environment.-Engage with Product, Business, Engineering, and Marketing teams to understand the needs, capture requirements and be the liaison between analytics and business.-Improve data quality and analytic rigor:Monitor and triage production runs for ensuring data security and veracity.Proactively identify performance / data quality problems, and remedy them.Continuously refine data quality with testing, tooling and performance evaluation.
Requirements:-Strong experience with R or Python in addition to SQL and data science libraries.-Expertise in data analytics and engineering.-Experience with agile software processes, data-driven product development, reliability, and experimentation.-Strong communications and collaboration skills. Ability to work with varied functional teams. An effective team player with a fundamental respect for all people and their values.-Quick learning, adapt to changes, manage priorities keeping company and team‚Äôs goal in mind.-The drive and ability to advise Product Managers and executives.-The ability to work around challenges and changing priorities.-3+ years of professional experience in data engineering/analytics/science.

For a more detailed look at our company and values, visit our website at https://www.teladochealth.com/
At Teladoc Health we thrive on difference and individuality. Teladoc Health is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

title: Senior Data Architect
description:
WONDERING WHAT‚ÄôS WITHIN DANAHER? TAKE A CLOSER LOOK. 
At first glance, you‚Äôll see Danaher‚Äôs scale. With $22.3B revenue, our 69,000 associates work across the globe at more than 25 unique operating companies within four platforms ‚Äî life sciences, diagnostics, water quality, and product identification.
Career development is important to us - you‚Äôll find associates who are as certain about their impact as they are about where they‚Äôre headed next. You‚Äôll find the Danaher Business System, which makes everything possible. You‚Äôll also see a company that investors trust‚Äîour culture of continuous improvement has helped us outperform the S&P 500 by more than 5,000% over the past 25 years.
We hope you‚Äôll see yourself here, too. What you find at Danaher ‚Äî and within yourself ‚Äî might just change the world.
WHO WE ARE: 
ESKO is a global provider of integrated software and hardware solutions that accelerate the go-to-market process of packaged goods. For each stakeholder in the process, Esko solutions enable them to deliver right-first-time packaging and marketing content.
WITHIN YOUR TEAM
You will be working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out solutions to our wide range of customer segments - CPG Brands, Global Life Science customers & Global Packaging Manufactures and service providers. Successful candidate must have a good understanding of the data lifecycle (ingest, transform, curate, analyse, predict, govern) and the latest in data management, data architectures for SaaS applications and analytic technologies including AI, Graph and NLP technologies.
Come work with our dedicated and innovative team to shape the future of our platform and the industry.
THIS JOB IS A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY TO: 
As Data Architect, you will define the data strategy, data architecture and oversee the implementation of this data architecture that will be the backbone for Esko‚Äôs software platform and AI capabilities. The Data Architect will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining the Esko Software Platform data architecture. This includes ensuring data is stored, organised, and accessible in a way that meets the needs of the Esko‚Äôs current and future product roadmap and platform aspirations. The Data Architect will work closely with the Product management, R&D, DevOps, and business stakeholders to create and maintain data models and structures that support the organisation's current and future technology landscape and innovation ambitions.
WITHIN YOUR ROLE, YOU WILL:
Work with industry leaders, customers, product management and technical teams to understand data requirements and design appropriate data models and structures for the ESKO software platformStay abreast of the industry trends shaping the ESKO business and associated data architecture requirements and best practices in data architecture, AI and AnalyticsIdentifying data sources, both internal and external, and working out a plan for data management that is aligned with the Esko platform strategyDesign and develop data architectures that support functional and nonfunctional domains covered by the ESKO product portfolioWork with the Data Science team to identify data needs and requirements around ML/AI use cases and incorporate then into the data architecture evolution.Develop strategies for data storage, organization, and access that meet the evolving needs of our software productsProvide guidance and support to development teams in implementing data structures and models in line with platform strategy and SaaS standards and architecture patterns.Document and communicate data architecture design and implementation to stakeholders.
WE ARE LOOKING FOR A PROFESSIONAL WHO HAS:
Ability to implement common data management and reporting technologies, as well as the basics of columnar and NoSQL databases, data visualisation, unstructured data, and predictive analyticsStrong understanding of predictive modeling, Machine learning, NLP and text analysisAbility to implement common data management and reporting technologies, as well as the basics of columnar and NoSQL databases, data visualisation, unstructured data, and predictive analytics.Design and development of AI driven applicationsExperienced with both relational and non-relational databases & familiarity with cloud-based data storage and data management architectures and platformsProblem solver with strong analytical skills
OUR CORE VALUES: 
We believe that real breakthroughs come from teams that think big and respect each other‚Äôs differences ‚Äì different ideas, different perspectives, and different experiences. We encourage all voices to be heard, both internally as we collaborate and externally as we listen to our customers‚Äô most pressing needs. And we would love to have you on this journey with us! Apply today.
Our Shared Purpose ‚Äì Helping Realize Life‚Äôs Potential ‚Äì expresses our reason for being and the impact that every one of us at Danaher strives to have on the world. Our Core Values define the fundamental beliefs that guide our actions. The Core Behaviours* enable our values and Shared Purpose, powered by DBS as our proven system for achieving success at Danaher.
YOUR EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE WILL INCLUDE: 
At least 10 years of experience in data architecture, database design, or a related field with hands on experience designing data architectures for SaaS platforms with AI capabilitiesMaster's degree or Equivalent in computer science, information systems, or a related fieldKnowledge of systems development, including system development life cycle, project management approaches and requirements, design, and testing techniquesKnowledge of programming languages Python, C/C++, Java, and Perl
OUR BENEFITS:
We offer you an employee bonus based on business success as well as annual salary review Company pension, accident insurance and preventive healthcare (medical, dental, and visual) on day 1Training and development opportunities401K savings planTuition reimbursement from Day 1Attractive employee referral programmePaid Maternity & paternity payEmployee events, sports, and social clubsDanaher Wellbeing Program, with rewardsEmployee Assistance Program (legal, financial, and counselling resources)
You can find detailed information at https://www.danaherbenefitsinfo.com/. *US ONLY
OUR OFFER: 
You will be part of a dynamic team in which there is a high focus on delivering results and continuous improvement, but also where having fun and teamwork is very important. It's a fast-paced environment, a consultative role, where you will get to partner with people to achieve their strategic business goals. You will work in a leading global company, with a manager who cares about you, your strengths and will help you to develop the best possible version of yourself. At Danaher, your potential is amplified. Our culture of continuous improvement defines who we are, drives our success, and translates to a career without limits for our team of 65,000 intellectually curious associates. Listen to our voices: https://jobs.danaher.com/global/en/our-difference.
UNSOLICITED ASSISTANCE
We do not accept unsolicited assistance from any headhunters or recruitment firms for any of our job openings. All resumes or profiles submitted by search firms to any employee at any of the Product Identification Platform companies, including Videojet Technologies, X-Rite/Pantone, Esko, Alltec-Foba, Laetus and Linx, in any form without a valid, signed search agreement in place for the specific position, will be deemed the sole property of the Operating Company. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Operating Company as a result of the unsolicited referral.
Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. The ‚ÄúEEO is the Law‚Äù poster is available here.
When you join us, you‚Äôll also be joining Danaher‚Äôs global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you‚Äôll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.
At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.
If you‚Äôve ever wondered what‚Äôs within you, there‚Äôs no better time to find out.

title: BI Data Engineer
description:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. Under its four leading online travel agency brands ‚Äì eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo ‚Äì it serves more than 17 million customers per year across 45 markets. Listed on the Spanish Stock Market, eDreams ODIGEO works with over 665 airlines and has partnerships with 130. The brand offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for consumers across the globe.
The BI Data Engineer will work within the BI team in an agile environment working on the current BI platform migration from Oracle to Google Cloud Big Data technology. His main responsibilities will cover the full ETL process, from data gathering to basic dashboard building. The new platform will be able to support billions of records per day.
Main Responsibilities:
 Understand and translate Product Owners needs into specific tasks.  Analyse, document and develop reports targeted to a variety of users.  Data load processes development and optimization.  Data QA control.  Support users when needed.  Liaise with other areas of the BI department. 
Desired skills and experience:
 BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent (IT engineer), Mathematics, Physics, Economics, etc.  +4 years of solid proficiency experience in Python.  +2 year experience in SQL and data modelling.  +2 years experience in ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator, Power Center, Kettle or such.  +1 year experience in Google Cloud Composer (Airflow), Data Proc and BigQuery.  +2 year experience working in agile environments.  Experience in Visualization tools such as Microstrategy, Looker, Data Studio or Qlikview is desirable but not mandatory.  Analytic mind, organised, team player and self-starter. With attention to detail and focused on results and productivity.  English is a must. 
What we offer:
 We support a phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance with our flexible hours and flexible remote work policy.  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.  Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.  Free subscription to Coursera Learning Platform.  Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.  We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy.  New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.  Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.  Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand! 
‚Ä¶ And the opportunity to work on a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!
Come dream with us and join us now!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Data Specialist
description:

title: Data Architect - Digital Markets
description:
About Gartner Digital Markets:
Gartner Digital Markets is a business unit within Gartner. Our mission is to help small businesses make the right technology choices and find the tools they need to grow, optimize, and become more effective at what they do. The business is comprised of three top brands‚ÄîCapterra, Software Advice, and GetApp. For candidates interested in taking their next career step in the technology space, Gartner Digital Markets offers the fast pace and excitement of working for a startup, the stability and resources of a large, established organization, and the opportunity to be on the front lines of innovation in an industry that is always growing and transforming.
What we‚Äôre looking for: 
As an Enterprise Data Architect, you will be a key technical expert overseeing GDM's data product build & operations and drive a strong vision for how multiple teams can proactively create a positive impact on the business. As a member of the engineering team, you will help lead the development of very large and complex data applications into cloud environments directly impacting the design, architecture, and implementation of GDM's data products around topics like performance management, vendor services, vendor portal, analytics, reporting and data science.
We are looking for a person who has helped separate business units to operate as a single entity, someone who has demonstrated leadership to make significant changes to move towards centralized solutions for common services and keep autonomy where it makes sense to do so.
Why you‚Äôll want to come to work:
Build the enterprise products that meet high performance, high availability, and maintainability standards, using current and emerging big data technologies. Design scalable patterns and architecture to support both batch and real-time data products & platforms using Microservices, Spark, Kafka, Snowflake or other Cloud data warehousing technologies and SageMaker. Work with product managers, stakeholders , technology teams and data engineers within the enterprise data governance process to define and conceptualize data models across enterprise master data, transaction data, and informational data and implement those models into the enterprise data model. Making tactical architecture decisions to support immediate projects but will be a key expert informing long term data architecture strategy:Design, implement and demonstrate solutions that exhibit the highest levels of performance, security, scalability and reliability to the End-Customer. Leading design and architecture of a feature or product, mentoring and guiding the engineering and product team, performing code reviews for critical features, when necessary, not afraid of jumping in to help with specific programming challenges. Experience solving unstructured data related issues, such as, alignment between producers and consumers, data contracts and schema evolution, versioning and introduction of non breaking changes. GDM is moving towards a real-time, enterprise message bus architecture and we want to ensure data producers move into a more active role of owning and taking responsibility for their data quality and data delivery and more importantly into understanding how the data is going to be used downstream by their consumers for reporting and data science use cases. 
What you‚Äôll bring to the team:
7+ years of experience with Data Lake Infrastructure, Data Warehousing, Data Modelling and Data Analytics tools by working with agile methodology. 10+ years of experience developing enterprise data models. 5+ years of cloud experience in at least one major cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP). Experience in at least one data modeling tool (ER/Studio, Erwin / Miro / Lucidchart).. Experience with at least one massively parallel processing database technology such as Snowflake, Redshift or Synapse. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, along with the strong ability to influence senior level management and stakeholders. Proven track record of leading, mentoring, hiring and scaling technology teams. Strong change manager: comfortable with change, especially that which arises through company growth. Ability to understand and translate business requirements into data and technical requirements. High degree of organization and ability to manage multiple, competing projects and priorities simultaneously. Proven experience working on a data driven company, following Data Governance principles and procedures and helping to define them when needed
Check out our video to learn about who we are, and what we do:
youtube.com/watch?v=oSO_h5VZ9a0
What you‚Äôll find:
Limitless growth and learning opportunities. A collaborative and positive culture - join a diverse team of professionals that are as smart and driven as you. A chance to make an impact - your work will contribute directly to our strategy. Frequent social activities such as movie night, laser tag, bowling, escape room, summer beach party, hiking & bbq, and more!Hybrid environment with flexibility, remote work, Friday afternoons free, and more. New offices close to Gl√≤ries and the beach in the fantastic, ‚Äúinnovation and tech‚Äù 22@ district of sunny Barcelona. Fresh fruit, snacks, selection of teas, fair trade organic coffee and a fridge full of beer for our Thursday Beer O‚ÄôClock. 
What you‚Äôll receive:
Competitive compensation packages. 23 days annual holiday, and additional days off for your birthday, 24th & 31st of December. Access to Pluralsight, Udemy and FrontendMasters online tech skills development platformsPrivate Medical and Dental Care. Life and Disability Insurance. Public Transport Subsidy. Ticket Restaurant Card. Childcare Vouchers (Ticket Guarderia). IncentiFit - annual reimbursement for health-and-wellness-related activities. Spanish lessons. Pension Scheme. Tuition Reimbursement. Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Employee Assistance Program. Gartner Gives Charity Match. Relocation Assistance - a specialist to help you with all the appointments and paperwork. 
What are we:
Action Oriented - Deliver fast, get great results. We embrace the vision, roadmap to success and the action it takes to make it happen. Intellectually Curious - Seek to learn, love to teach. We‚Äôre humble and embrace respectful, radical candor with a mindset of ongoing professional and personal development. Collaborative - One team, shared mission. We welcome feedback and understand the value of working together to accomplish more than what is possible individually. 
Web: gartner.com/en/digital-markets
Careers: jobs.gartner.com/teams/digital-markets
PLEASE NOTE:
 Applications must be submitted in English.  A valid EU visa/passport is required for this position. 
#digitalmarkets
Who are we?
Gartner delivers actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization‚Äôs mission-critical priorities. We‚Äôve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?
Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger‚Äîas individuals, as communities and as an organization. That‚Äôs why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World‚Äôs Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner
What we offer:
Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you‚Äôll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.
The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
Job Requisition ID:75561
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
