title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
DescriptionWe are a remote-first, international SaaS company helping businesses maximise their revenue potential in Europe and the US with our Go-To-Market SaaS Platform. We are the successful merger of Leadfeeder and Echobot, bringing two industry leaders together.What makes us unique? With origins in Finland and Germany, the country with the highest privacy standards in Europe, Dealfront was born with compliance and transparency in its DNA. This ensures that our users know exactly where their data originated. Compliance does not affect companies' earnings.We have over 330 dealfronters around the world in 40 countries. Join us and help us continue our mission to be the leading Go-To-Market platform that helps B2B companies win deals in Europe.

Position overviewAs a Data Analyst, you will be joining the Data Quality Team to own everything related to data analytics there. Your main focus is to analyze the data we provide to our clients. This includes comparisons with competitors, uncovering data weaknesses, supporting sales and customer service with meaningful insights, developing dashboards that allow us to continuously monitor our data quality and quantity.

ResponsibilitiesYou will visualize data, design dashboards, KPIs, and monitor data landscape for outliers, issues, or unexpected behaviorYou will analyze data drift, evaluate, and forecast data quality and predict developmentsYou will assess new data sources and support strategic decision-making processesYou will compare data sources and quality with those of our competitors

RequirementsA data background, a degree in mathematics, computer science or a comparable qualificationProficiency in at least one programming language (PHP/Python preferred) as well as knowledge in SQLProficient English Level

Nice to haveExperience with Solr, ElasticSearch/ELK-Stack, AWS Redshift or comparable Routine in data crunchingKnowledge in Data Visualisation Software (e.g. Tableau)

PerksThe chance to work with a very knowledgeable, high-achieving and fun teamAn international, diverse, dynamic and committed work environmentThe opportunity to work remotely, with a flexible work scheduleMental Health support with AuntieAnnual company retreats in sunny locations and team off-sites - Last year we went to Croatia ;)

title: Senior Data Scientist - Spain
description:
Are you proactive, adventurous and looking for new high professional challenges? Would you like to grow in an International experienced and very colaborative team?  We have an opportunity that might interest you!
As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be part of the new established functional unit "Digital Business" (DBIZ) is part of Deutsche Telekom Technik (DTT). As Senior Data Engineer you will work in projects to become Europe's leading digital telco by utilizing data as an asset along relevant business goals in the domain of mobile and fixed line networks.
DTT plans, builds, and runs wireless and optical networks for our customers in Germany, We as DBIZ provide digitization solutions for DTT starting from the idea over solution- and software design and implementation.
We offer tailor-made consulting & accompaniment by highly qualified data analysts, project managers and agile coaches. We drive cultural change as a catalyst for the digital transformation. We generate digitization synergies through a consistent overall view across all specialist areas.
Our vision: More is possible with DBIZ.Our motto: Think. Explore. Digitize.
This position is 100% remote from Spain although we have offices in across multiple locations, such as Barcelona, Madrid, Bilbao, Granada, Reus, Sevilla, Valencia and more on which you will be to work in case you want!
üëâ Main Responsibilities:In a cross functional project team, you will be responsible forDevelop data pipelines and their architecture to serve new Data Analytics ProductsConnect data sources to our big data platforms and manage the data on them (Hadoop, Elastic, ..)Support building up new platforms including the development environment, CI/CD pipeline, test environmentPre-filter and clean the dataSupport data analysts to prepare and set-up data visualization (tools still need to be chosen)Design the platform, make architectural decisionsSupporting the data analysts visualizing the dataBuild Spark queries to efficiently gather the required data.In close collaboration with Data Scientists and domain experts, you will process the data and generate features, helping us to meet the scalability demands of our analytics use cases.
üëç What do we expect from you?100% fluent in English. (You will be working within an international team!)You completed your studies with a master‚Äôs degree in computer science, mathematics, physics or similar or you have a comparable job education or additional training. In addition, you have multiple years professional experience in software and/or data engineering.
üíª What could be a great addition?Around 6 years professional software / data engineering experienceProfessional expertise in scripting languages and software engineering tools,especially Python, SQL, GITFirst-hand experience in setting upETL chains and handling big data on a Hadoop cluster using PySpark or Spark SQL.Expertise in modern big data technologies likeHadoop, SparkConfident handling with docker, ideally also Kubernetes and other cloud technologiesExcitement for (Test) Automation, Continuous Integration and passion for top software qualitySpecial interest in upcoming and future technologies and high willingness to familiarize yourself with new topicsExperience with Agile Engineering PracticesYou are team player with agile mindset and can-do mentality, and you have experience in agile methods like e.g. Scrum
Some good pluses!Knowledge of tools like Oozie, Airflow, Elasticsearch.Knowledge on different IT areas such as networks or DevOps.
ü§≤ Let us do a rundown of what we will be offering you!Value-oriented innovation culture combined with unique resources and capabilitiesDiverse team with continuous top rates on employee satisfactionWorldwide collaboration with top domain experts and inspiring leaders.Learning and developing program for all sort of areas.Access to broad horizontal and vertical learning and training opportunitiesFull remote working model. The position can be done on a fully remote setting from anywhere Spain, this implies your residency has to be in SpainFlextimeFlexible Benefits PlanLife and accident InsuranceNursery TicketAnd much more!

Come to the Magenta side!T-Systems Iberia will only process the CVs of those who meet the requirements specified for each offer. ONLY CVs IN ENGLISH WILL BE CONSIDERED.

title: Data & Transformation Office Leader
description:
NTT DATA somos todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de m√°s de 139.000 profesionales, tan diverso c√≥mo diversos son los 50 pa√≠ses en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad; telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, energ√≠a, administraci√≥n p√∫blica y sanidad. ¬øNuestra misi√≥n? Todo gracias a la colaboraci√≥n entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovaci√≥n que nos acerca al futuro. Nuestra esencia nos ha llevado a la vanguardia de la tecnolog√≠a, a romper paradigmas y a brindar las soluciones que realmente se corresponden a las necesidades de cada cliente. Desde la oficina de Transformaci√≥n y Dato de NTT Data estamos buscando un Data & Transformation Office Leader que desarrolle su misi√≥n ayud√°ndonos a liderar la Transformaci√≥n Digital en NTT Data.La oficina del Dato y Transformaci√≥n es de reciente creaci√≥n y queremos rodearnos de los mejores profesionales para realizar el an√°lisis y ejecutar la propuesta de eficiencias a trav√©s de la Tecnolog√≠a y el Dato en nuestra propia compa√±√≠a. Para ello, nos apoyaremos en las mejores y m√°s vanguardistas tecnolog√≠as del mercado.
FUNCIONESTus principales responsabilidades dentro de este rol ser√°n liderar/participar en:Analizar las diferentes √°reas de la compa√±√≠a y su situaci√≥n actual ‚ÄúAS-IS‚Äù de su operativa, identificando pain points y oportunidades de mejora e innovaci√≥n.Coordinar y liderar sesiones de trabajo con las √°reas.Preparar propuestas de Digitalizaci√≥n apoy√°ndose en distintas ‚Äúpalancas‚Äù a disposici√≥n de la oficina Data & Advanced Analytics, Process mining, RPA, Document Management, Virtual Assistants, Gobierno del dato y de la operativa, Reingenier√≠a de Procesos, etc.Proponer mejoras y eficiencias, coordin√°ndose con los expertos de dichas ‚Äúpalancas‚Äù para analizar c√≥mo conseguirlas.Construcci√≥n de Business Case plasmando las eficiencias, costes de implantaci√≥n, calendario, etc.Definir el modelo ‚ÄúTO BE‚Äù de las √°reas de la compa√±√≠a despu√©s de la implantaci√≥n de las mejoras.Coordinar y supervisar la implantaci√≥n de las iniciativas propuestas y monitorizar las eficiencias.Liderar las iniciativas de despliegue del Gobierno del Dato y del Plan de Adopci√≥n en aquellas √°reas de las que sea responsable.

title: Data Scientist (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo
We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.
At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!
We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.
In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
Your Work-life Opportunity
Glovo is looking for world-class Data Scientists to work in our Barcelona office. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to grow in one of the fastest growing startups of Barcelona, building a product that will change people's day-to-day lives and disrupt the on-demand market?
Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Develop, test and productionize predictive algorithms by using state of the art machine learning algorithms and statistical modelsEvaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. cross validation with holdouts strategy) and online experiments (e.g. cross validation, A/B testing)Contribute to one or more of the following areas: customer analytics, personalisation & recommendations , pricing as well as operational research & optimisationDesign experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusionsCreate dashboards and reports to regularly communicate results and monitor key metricsWork in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering, operations, marketing amongst others
You Have
Research and development experience in industry or academia. Holds at least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or MathematicsDeep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, game theory, statistical inference, bayesian statistics, causal inference, time series analysis, decision theory, mathematical optimisationExperience working with large data sets will be a plusPython experience;; can independently prototype solutions to problemsExperience with big data technologies (e.g. Scala and Spark) and AWS is desirableCommand line skillsStrong presentation skills in communicating with experts and novicesFluent spoken and written English
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Competitive Pay and Enticing Equity plan Top-notch private health insuranceMonthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products Zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Discounted gym memberships Flexible time off (take the time you need) Flexible working model - Combining 2 days a week working from home and up to 3 weeks a year working from abroadEnhanced parental leave including nursery supportWellbeing via free online therapy and emotional support solutions External learning opportunities Office fun activities from drinks to cinema nights! 
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quicklyCare: Uplift people and the planetGood Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!
Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!
Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: Data Engineer
description:
What is Exoticca?Do you like traveling? Do you enjoy the exotic? Do you like strong challenges? If the answer is YES, welcome to Exoticca!
Exoticca is a company that started in 2013 by professionals specialized in the creation and online distribution of voyages. Our mission is to offer our clients the possibility to visit the most beautiful and stimulating places in our planet, though the best holiday packages, at unbelievable prices. For more comfort, our customers can find out more about our trips and book them instantly in a matter of minutes through our website, avoiding the usual long exchanges of email, meetings, or calls required by more traditional travel agencies.
At Exoticca we are looking for people who want to offer their best to create unforgettable experiences for our customers. We are a young, dynamic, multicultural team of 140+ people, in rapid international growth, seeking for new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation. 
We are a highly ambitious and well-funded start-up, backed by top national and international investors that have also participated in the growth of other success stories, such as Glovo, SinDelantal.com, or Idealista, among others.

What about the Data team?At Exoticca, the Data team is the main responsible of making data essential in key decision making across the whole organization. We capture vasts amount of data from multiple customer touch points, spanning from consideration and booking, to pre-travel, travel, and post-travel. Combined with our customer-centric approach, we believe that our data-driven culture is the key to deliver unparalleled product & services, that wow our customers and create unforgettable experiences to be remembered for a lifetime.
Join us as a Data Engineer in order to achieve such ambitious goals, our Data team works together with other departments, such as Marketing, Flight Product, Travel Product, Sales or Customer Experience, to uncover the most valuable insights our data can deliver and convert them into actual company initiatives, business decisions, or product features. There are a myriad of opportunities for using data to learn more about our customers, to grow sales, increase customer satisfaction, optimize & automate processes, and much more. We can‚Äôt wait to have you on board!
Which will be your main responsibilities?Be part of a team that takes end-to-end responsibility for designing, building, and maintaining batch & real-time data pipelines and data solutions.Create solutions to enable diagnostic and predictive analytics capabilities.Research, evaluate, and propose different data solutions in an agnostic way.Select, setup and manage tools & technologies to build and support a robust data infrastructure.Propose and help decide on the data modeling and schema design of our data stores.

Which are the job requirements?2+ years of work experience in a similar role as a Data Engineer.Experience working with Python.Experience with relational databases , data warehouses, data lakes and data marts.Familiarity with cloud-based, distributed systems and orchestrated ETL processes (AWS is preferred).Experience in data management, integrating and transforming data from multiple sources, including internal DBs and APIs.Fluency in English.
Benefits:Competitive compensation package in line with job responsibilities and experience.Additionally, we propose the use of flexible compensation management for diet, transportation, private health insurance, and personal training purposes.Hybrid work model/full remote: you can work from home or the office at your convenience. Offices in the heart of Barcelona (right next to Pla√ßa Catalunya).Permanent contract from the start.Travel packages at reduced prices!.Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you.Unlimited coffee, team lunches, English lessons.And last but not least, becoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at an agile and rapid growing organization!.
Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law.

title: DATA SCIENTIST
description:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasi√≥n por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en 118 pa√≠ses y nuestra presencia online se extiende a m√°s de 80 pa√≠ses. Nuestro equipo est√° formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 80% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

DATA SCIENTIST

¬øC√ìMO SER√Å TU D√çA A D√çA EN MANGO?

Estamos buscando un/a Machine Learning Engineer para unirse a nuestro equipo de Data&Advanced Analytics.

Formar√°s parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. El equipo de Advanced Analytics desarrolla algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial dirigidos a optimizar los procesos y decisiones m√°s desafiantes dentro de la industria del retail.

El equipo de Advanced Analytics de Mango est√° formado por Data Scientist, Ingenieros de Big Data, Machine Learning Engineer e Ingenieros de Software que trabajan juntos en squads multidisciplinares para desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje autom√°tico de calidad de vanguardia aprovechando la √∫ltima tecnolog√≠a en plataformas de Big Data y computaci√≥n distribuida.

Cada una de las brigadas de an√°lisis avanzado tiene como objetivo desarrollar y evolucionar algoritmos de aprendizaje autom√°tico para hacer frente a algunos de los principales retos t√©cnicos y empresariales de Mango:
 Personalitazion Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial para proporcionar una experiencia personalizada a los clientes del sitio web y de la App de Mango, incluyendo recomendaciones de producto, ajuste y tama√±o, aprovechando las capacidades de despliegue en tiempo real y el flujo de clics en tiempo real. Pricing and Mark-Down Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje autom√°tico que determinen las promociones y descuentos √≥ptimos para optimizar el margen de la empresa durante el periodo de ventas. Forecasting Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de previsi√≥n de series temporales para predecir la evoluci√≥n de las ventas y los rendimientos tanto a corto como a largo plazo. Purchasing/Production Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de ciencia de datos para la detecci√≥n temprana de best-sellers y para determinar cu√°ntas unidades de cada producto y talla debe fabricar Mango durante la planificaci√≥n de la temporada.

Debido a la relevancia de los proyectos de Mango Advanced Analytics, cada squad tiene visibilidad y presentaciones a nivel de junta directiva.

¬øC√ìMO ES NUESTRO EQUIPO?

En Mango nos inspira y une nuestra pasi√≥n por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos presentes en 118 pa√≠ses y nuestra presencia online se extiende a m√°s de 80 pa√≠ses. Nuestro equipo est√° formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades, de las cuales el 80% son mujeres.

Somos un equipo muy din√°mico, motivado por las nuevas tecnolog√≠as, con pasi√≥n por lo que hacemos y ganas de asumir grandes retos que nos permitan seguir creciendo y aportando valor a trav√©s de los datos.

¬øQU√â HACE UN MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER EN MANGO?

Como Machine Learning Engineer formar√°s parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. Trabajar√°s desarrollando soluciones de Inteligencia Artificial desarrolladas con modelos de datos y algoritmos de √∫ltima generaci√≥n. Estos productos de datos permiten casos de uso muy innovadores en el espacio del retail, como la geoanal√≠tica, la robotizaci√≥n, la personalizaci√≥n omnicanal, la tienda conectada, la visi√≥n por ordenador, el consumidor 360¬∫ y las decisiones en tiempo real.

En tu d√≠a a d√≠a‚Ä¶
Dise√±ar√°s, desarrollar√°s y mantendr√°s pipelines para la extracci√≥n, limpieza y transformaci√≥n de datos con Spark.Trabajar√°s con una gran variedad de datos (estructurados y no estructurados) relacionados con el producto y todo su ciclo de vida, desde la fase inicial de dise√±o hasta la venta en nuestros diferentes canales.Realizar√°s la puesta en producci√≥n de soluciones con algoritmos avanzados de aprendizaje autom√°tico para mejorar nuestros procesos y decisiones comerciales principales.Participar√°s en la definici√≥n de la arquitectura de las soluciones de anal√≠tica avanzada desarrolladas por el squad y su posible integraci√≥n con herramientas y aplicaciones desarrolladas por otros equipos.Definir√°s e implementar√°s mecanismos para la orquestaci√≥n y monitorizaci√≥n de los procesos y aplicaciones desarrolladas.Participar√°s en la automatizaci√≥n de tests, CI/CD y despliegue autom√°tico de nuestras aplicaciones. Ayudar√°s en la definici√≥n y mejora de los est√°ndares de calidad del c√≥digo.Estar√°s conectado a los √∫ltimos desarrollos en Big Data y MLOps e invertir√°s tiempo en traer nuevas tecnolog√≠as y mejores pr√°cticas a Mango.

¬øQU√â ESPERAMOS DE TI?
Grado en Inform√°tica, Ingenier√≠a u otros campos cuantitativosAl menos 3 a√±os de experiencia desarrollando en Python, Scala, u otro lenguaje orientado a objetos.Experiencia en el desarrollo de ELT escalable, procesos de integraci√≥n de datos con Spark, Spark Structured Streaming o cualquier otra tecnolog√≠a de procesamiento de datos.Experiencia en la construcci√≥n y el mantenimiento de cargas de datos complejas con un alto volumen y orquestando dependencias (por ejemplo, Airflow).Experiencia llevando a cabo proyectos que involucren algoritmos de Machine Learning, idealmente en un entorno cloud con computaci√≥n distribuida. Se valorar√° la experiencia desarrollando modelos matem√°ticos y algoritmos predictivos (optimizaci√≥n, modelos supervisados y no supervisados, clustering, redes neuronales...).Persona comprometida, proactiva, que se preocupe por la calidad de sus entregables, y una mentalidad hands-on.Se valora muy positivamente el inter√©s en buenas pr√°cticas de programaci√≥n y desarrollo de software: tests, automatizaciones, construyas pipelines en CI, etc.Se valora haber trabajado con servicios de AWS (por ejemplo, S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, API Gateway, Glue, Athena, ECR/ECS), y Databricks es muy deseable.Capacidad para poseer la entrega de un proyecto, incluyendo la comunicaci√≥n con otros equipos de IT.

¬øQU√â NOS HACE ESPECIALES?
Incorporaci√≥n inmediata con contrato indefinido.Ofrecemos horario flexible (puedes entrar de 8 a 9.30 y salir de 17 a 18.30) con jornada intensiva todos los viernes (puedes entrar de 8 a 9 y salir de 14 a 15) y la mayor√≠a de las vigilias de festivosNuestras oficinas se encuentran en Palau- Solita i Plegamans.Posibilidad de teletrabajo en un 50%.35% de descuento en todas nuestras l√≠neas Te podr√°s formar a nivel t√©cnico en plataformas como O'Reilly, entre otras, as√≠ como en idiomas, y en habilidades para tu desarrollo personal. Te acompa√±amos para que sigas creciendo a nivel profesional y personal!Pol√≠tica de referrals, podr√°s participar en la incorporaci√≥n de talento a nuestros equipos, ¬°y te recompensaremos por ello! Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vall√®s para llegar a nuestras oficinas centralesServicio de fisioterapia en las oficinas centrales, as√≠ como sala de fitness y vestuarios por si te gusta hacer deporte en tu tiempo libreWorkshops, meetups, comunidades de pr√°cticas, team buildings y company meetingsPaquete de retribuci√≥n flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro m√©dico, formaci√≥n, descuento comedor, guarder√≠as etcServicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de la central. La empresa subvenciona parte del men√∫ diario, as√≠ como los art√≠culos de cafeter√≠a.Servicio m√©dico propio en las instalaciones de la central.Formar√°s parte de una empresa l√≠der en el sector de la moda, din√°mica, en plena innovaci√≥n, con gran concienciaci√≥n y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidadAmbiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso, trabajar√°s con un gran equipo que va en la misma direcci√≥n para conseguir los mejores resultadosOportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo 

You got it?

title: Data Scientist
description:
FHIOS Smart Knowledge
FHIOS es una empresa tecnol√≥gica centrada en las personas, en la que valoramos lo que aportas para crear, entre todos, un equipo con talento y apasionado por el mundo digital. Para ello, nos mantenemos siempre a la vanguardia de las nuevas tecnolog√≠as para aportar soluciones de valor a las futuras necesidades digitales.
Descripci√≥n de la oferta
En FHIOS estamos buscando Data Scientist para colaborar en el equipo de un importante cliente del sector tecnol√≥gico.
¬øQui√©n es FHIOS?

¬°Con√≥cenos!
Somos una consultor√≠a tecnol√≥gica que lleva m√°s de 25 a√±os ayudando a las empresas a transformarse en el √°mbito digital, desde la realizaci√≥n de proyectos personalizados de marketing digital, desarrollo web y administraci√≥n de sistemas hasta proyectos que introduce a empresas en el entorno digital desde cero.
FHIOS se basa en 5 pilares b√°sicos que, adem√°s, ¬°conforman nuestras siglas!: Factor Humano, Honestidad, Innovaci√≥n, Optimizaci√≥n y Smart.
Y no es de extra√±ar que Factor Humano se posicione primero porque, sin nuestro equipo, FHIOS no ser√≠a lo mismo.
¬°Todos nuestros √©xitos se lo debemos a nuestro FHIOSTeam!
Por eso, para nosotros es muy importante que las personas que formen parte de FHIOS sean personas resolutivas, creativas, pero, sobre todo, que nos aporten compa√±erismo y mucha energ√≠a positiva.
¬øCompartes nuestros valores? ¬°Te explicamos m√°s!
¬øCu√°l ser√° tu misi√≥n?
An√°lisis de datos brutos: evaluaci√≥n de la calidad, limpieza, estructuraci√≥n para el procesamiento posterior. Dise√±ar algoritmos de predicci√≥n precisos y escalables. Colaborar con el equipo de ingenier√≠a para llevar los prototipos anal√≠ticos a la producci√≥n. 
¬øY qu√© ofrecemos nosotros a cambio?
Modelo de trabajo h√≠brido. Flexibilidad horaria. Contrato indefinido. Gracias al programa Onboarding tendr√°s la bienvenida virtual m√°s acogedora posible. El saber no ocupa lugar Por eso, creemos que el potencial de nuestro equipo tiene que seguir desarroll√°ndose. Para ello, ofrecemos cursos formativos como certificaciones o acceso a plataformas como Udemy. Distrib√∫yete tu salario como quieras con nuestro Plan de Retribuci√≥n flexible: Ticket para el transporte, restaurante y guarder√≠a, seguro m√©dico. Creemos en la diversidad e igualdad de oportunidades. Nuestro Comit√© de Igualdad tiene el objetivo de fomentar la paridad de toda la familia FHIOS. Si eres de aquellas personas a las que les gusta cuidarse tanto por dentro como por fuera, ¬°FHIOS es tu sitio! Te financiamos parte del gimnasio con Andjoy. Hay oficinas que requieren un dress code formal. No es nuestro caso, as√≠ que ¬°viste como quieras!¬øSab√≠as que si nos presentas a un futuro compa√±ero/a de FHIOS, tienes premio? Otro motivo m√°s para avisar a tus amigos de nuestras vacantes. 23 d√≠as de vacaciones anuales. Hay empresas que hacen afterworks una vez a la semana. ¬°En FHIOS lo llevamos al l√≠mite! Somos conocidos por organizar las mejores fiestas tem√°ticas y concursos con todo el equipo. ¬øNo te lo crees? √önete y lo descubrir√°s. 
Requisitos
¬øQu√© necesitamos que traigas contigo?
Experiencia de 3 a√±os en puestos similares. Experiencia en el desarrollo de aplicaciones escalables y de alta disponibilidad. Licenciatura en ingenier√≠a. Dominio de Python. Experiencia con ETL y sintaxis SQL. Experiencia con t√©cnicas estad√≠sticas/ML. Experiencia trabajando con herramientas de visualizaci√≥n. Experiencia trabajando con GIT. Nivel alto de ingl√©s, escrito y hablado. 
Valorable:
M√°ster / Doctorado en Inform√°tica o campo t√©cnico relacionado. Experiencia trabajando con deep learning. Experiencia trabajando con servicios en la nube.

title: Senior Tools and Data Pipeline Engineer - Digital Legends
description:
Job Title
Senior Tools and Data Pipeline Engineer - Digital Legends
Requisition ID
R021006
Job Description
Digital Legends is an Activision independent Studio based in Barcelona, formed by industry veterans and emerging talent who are focused on delivering a AAA gaming experience to mobile devices. Since it was founded in 2001, the studio has been a pioneer in mobile game development. It has a long, established history as a leading mobile development studio with a number of high-quality mobile titles built from the ground-up to its credits, including the award winning The Respawnables‚Ñ¢ series of games. We are creating an all-new, AAA mobile experience that will bring the thrilling, fluid and large-scale action of Call of Duty¬Æ: Warzone‚Ñ¢ to players on the go.
We are looking for a Senior Tools and data pipeline engineer to work on the core technology behind the game, especially the data pipeline to improve the support of mobile platforms.
Your Responsibilities
Support, develop and implement systems/tools to manage game asset and content.Contribute to R&D and finding creative solutions to improve current techniques and workflows.Deliver high quality work accorded to schedule.
Your Skills
Proficient in C++ programming language.Extensive experience with code and data debug and optimization.4+ years‚Äô game programming experience in a similar position.Experience optimizing pipelines and toolsA proactive attitude and open to receiving and implementing feedback.Working level of English.
It Is Always a Plus
C# or Python knowledge.3D math skills (linear algebra, vector math).Experience with software performance analysis, optimizations, and low-level programming.Experience in mobile development.
What We Offer
Competitive salary based on your experience.A wide range of perks such as private health and dental insurance, ticket restaurant, wellbeing voucher, 25 days + xmas period holidays and more.
And a great team of super skilled individuals that can help you grow as a professional.
We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide. Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do. At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.
R021006

title: Data Scientist - Insights (Product - Group Classes)
description:
Preply is a global language learning marketplace, connecting 50,000+ tutors with millions of learners from all over the world. Since the company launched in 2012, students have signed up to more than 15 million lessons.

Meet the team!At Preply, we are constantly running hundreds of AB tests, each with specific tracking and analytic requirements. This, along with the wide scope of our product and the sophistication of the tutor/learner interactions, makes for some rewarding challenges.
We have an outstanding data science organization, with a mission to enable the highest quality decision-making. We work throughout the company - in the product, business, and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference, and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Preply.
You‚Äôll be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, etc. to provide our tutors and learners with the best product experience.Visit our Tech Radar to learn about the technologies we use at Preply!
What You‚Äôll Be DoingMaster the dynamics of tutors/learners interaction and the economics of Preply‚Äôs marketplace;Leave your mark on an exciting new product: Group Classes! Be at the cutting edge of product and feature development within Preply, as we take a new strategic direction to help people learn together;Support one of our key pillars: Payments & Subscriptions! A rewarding part of the product, where even small improvements can bring positive impact to our customers and business metrics;Produce thorough data analytics of customer behavior and product usage, effectively communicating them to technical and non-technical audiences;Quantify the impact of new product features and initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap;Design, execute and evaluate experiments on a global scale;Collaborate with the Data Strategy team to define standards and best practices as well as sharing knowledge and capabilities across the team;Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators;Build relationships and collaborate with other data and/or technical leaders;Be a flexible data leader across the whole product spectrum;Partner with the team‚Äôs Product Manager to refine product initiatives into lean, experiment-led technical implementations;Work with the Data Engineering team to model data in our Data Warehouse and productionize your data pipelines;Work closely with our BI experts to develop effective data visualizations, reports and dashboards.
What You Need To SucceedExperience as a Data Scientist (around 4 years' experience minimum, more preferably);Good understanding of data analysis concepts such as conversion, LTV/CAC, Cohort analysis, Retention, etc.;Ability to confidently apply data science techniques, such as statistical modeling, in a marketplace context;Knowledge or experience in A/B testing and experiment design;Strong coding skills in one or more analytics languages (SQL, Python, etc.);Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills;Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new hypotheses;Good written and verbal communication skills. B1 English is a must.
Nice To HavePrevious experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C);Knowledge of Looker, Tableau, Amplitude or other BI tools;Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.).Masters degree or PhD in statistics, economics, econometrics, or a relevant field of applied mathematics (or equivalent business experience).
Why You‚Äôll Love It At PreplyAn open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;Access to free mental health support platforms;A flexible set-up with the option of paid relocation to Barcelona or working remotely within CET or 3 hours from CET;The opportunity to shape the lives of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).
About PreplyAt Preply, we focus on doing better every day ‚Äì pushing the limits of what we know is possible. And we know our purpose is strong. We‚Äôre re-engineering education, providing outstanding experiences for our global community of language learners and building authentic connections across the world.
Propelled by a tenfold increase in revenues over the last three years, thanks to our best-in-class consumer and b2b products, Preply is now leading the online language tutoring segment globally and has 400+ employees of over 50 nationalities based across Barcelona, Kyiv and the US. We do extraordinary things at Preply ‚Äì and we want you to join us. If you‚Äôre committed to curiosity, love experimentation and relish the challenge of exploring new ideas, then it‚Äôs time we said:Welcome to The World Class.
Our ValuesHuman: We embrace diversity by fostering inclusive environments where people feel respected and safe to express their opinions.Hungry: We make bold, data-informed decisions to deliver high-impact solutions for our customers.Humble: We experiment continuously by staying open to being challenged, learning from failures and making data-informed decisions.Hackers: We learn by doing, focus on things that matter and move with incredible speed to create simple, creative, and scalable solutions;Curious: We thrive on facing challenges, diving deep to identify root causes and uncovering insights to continuously improve.Learners Obsessed: We put our learners at the core of everything we do to improve the effectiveness of their language learning with us.
Diversity, Equity, and InclusionPreply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.That means that Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

title: Data Engineer
description:
At Clarity AI, we are committed to bringing social impact to markets. We are a tech company started in 2017, leveraging AI and machine learning technologies to ensure environmental, social and governance dimensions are the focal point of decision-making within financial markets.We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche B√∂rse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, Portugal, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!
Clarity is looking for a Senior Data Engineer for the Tech team.
If you‚Äôre a Software/Data Engineer, specialized in Data and enjoy solving complex problems with code, developing and you are not afraid of learning new things, we are looking for you.You will be part of the team delivering the different parts of our production-ready product while co-designing and implementing an architecture that can scale up with the product and the company.Our tech stack is documented here: https://stackshare.io/clarity-ai/clarity-ai-data
Location: This position can be based within Spain.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:You will help to build a data platform to enable other teams to self-service high-quality data while performing data operations to support their day-to-day actions.You will join the data engineering team which is responsible for developing models, practises and systems to support the data lifecycle.You‚Äôll support designing and creating all aspects of our ever-growing set of external and internal data pipelines, understand the problems, and tie them back to data engineering solutionsYou will be responsible of designing and building our ETL'sYou‚Äôll transform raw data from different sources (batch and near-real-time) into intuitive data models, using a diverse set of tools (such as Spark, Hadoop, Redshift, Kafka, etc.) to build robust data pipelines of high quality in a scalable fashion (regarding volume and maintainability).In order to develop feature and product features, you will form part of cross functional squads including people of many different teams.Work closely with Platform, Data Science and Backend teams, as well as product and tech teams.Fix, troubleshoot and solve bugs and issues
Requirements
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:We like engineers who adapt quickly to new challenges and break them down in smaller pieces that a highly productive team will find high-quality solutions for. As an Engineer, you will have a solid technical foundation and a strong focus on growing your development skills.They use best practices to ship high-quality code and continue to push their knowledge.You have more than +3 years of professional experience as a Software Developer/Data Engineer, and hold a degree in a quantitative field (CS, Engineer, Math, Physics, ‚Ä¶ ).You have built production data pipelines in the cloud, setting up data-lake and server-less solutions; on top of that, you have hands-on experience with schema design and data modeling.Proven knowledge of Python(Pandas) is required, Java/Scala will be a plusYou have strong SQL skills and knowledge and familiarity with other distributed data stores such as Redis, ElasticSearch, Druid, Cassandra, Hbase.You are comfortable working in containerized cloud developments, and familiar with the integration of public and private APIs.Strong communication skills. The right candidate can thrive in an environment of asynchronous conversation, since a part of the Clarity team will be based remotely.Open to try new technologies and programming languages.Fluency in EnglishIt will be a plus if you had:Experience in SaaS fast growing business would be preferable, although not required.Ideally experience in the financial sector or regulated markets.Familiarity with some other technologies / frameworks( Spring Boot, Jersey, Play..) is a plus
Benefits
WHAT WE OFFER:Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.Clarity‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences.We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).
Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.
We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That‚Äôs why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options.Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget.Additional benefits are available depending on your location.We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.
Clarity has received several awards:World Economic Forum PioneerOne of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation LabTop startup with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open TalentYoung Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017

title: Data Engineer - Operations (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will

Design, implement, and maintain Data Products that produce business-critical data reliably and efficiently using cloud technologies and engines for large-scale data analytics. This role requires software engineering skills combined with data analytics expertise. This is our tech stack: SQL, dbt, Python, Spark, Airflow, Kafka, AWS, Terraform, Docker, Datadog, Looker‚Ä¶

Think big and contribute to our Data Mesh strategy within Glovo, leading and contributing to initiatives in the Operations (Contact, Courier and Logistics) data domain. Collaborate with many Product, Engineering, and Business teams to produce relevant data products that can be used across multiple analytical use cases.

Raise the bar on best practices and technical quality standards for Glovo, contributing to the technical decisions across all teams and also making impactful contributions to our code base.

You Have
2-3 years of experience working in data engineering, software engineering or business intelligence Experience designing and building scalable and robust data pipelines to enable data-driven business decisionsProficiency and experience with Python, SQL, pipelines orchestration (Airflow), distributed data processing engines (Spark), event streaming (Kafka), cloud infrastructure (AWS)Good understanding of software development best practices and promoter of agile methodologiesExperience in gathering requirements and creating data modeling designsExcellent spoken and written English
Nice-to-haves
Experience with CI/CD tools (Github Actions, Jenkins)Experience with the Data Mesh approach
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Competitive Pay and Enticing Equity plan Top-notch private health insuranceMonthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products Zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Discounted gym memberships Flexible time off (take the time you need) Flexible working model - Combining 2 days a week working from home and up to 3 weeks a year working from abroadEnhanced parental leave including nursery supportWellbeing via free online therapy and emotional support solutions External learning opportunities Office fun activities from drinks to cinema nights! 
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quicklyCare: Uplift people and the planetGood Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d)
description:
Visi√≥n General 
Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. As one of the world‚Äôs leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker develops high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions that enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular, and microscopic levels. We have been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years and today, Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems, and a strong reputation among its customers. Worldwide, more than 7,500 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 90 locations on all continents.
Our Company is commercializing one of the most powerfully advantageous approaches in spatial
biology. The Company brings together the premier spatial omics approach with leading-edge data
acquisition and analysis capability. The pioneering in situ technology enables examination of some of
the most important questions in genomics and gene expression at the single cell and sub-cellular level.
We aim to find the best talent in the field to join and contribute to this extraordinary, exciting endeavor
becoming a critical member of this groundbreaking opportunity.
 Responsabilidades 
Position Description
 As Data Scientist, the candidate will be responsible for developing statistical methods for the analysis of spatial genomics data.  Using statistical and machine learning algorithms this role will develop tools to analyze spatial 3D genomic data and integrate it with other omics sources.  This position will work closely with software engineers in the analytics team to deliver easy to use reporting tools to help researchers explore, visualize and interpret the results of their datasets. 
Role
 Develop algorithms to analyze spatial information, identify patterns and segregate or group data.  Analyze performance and optimize solutions to enable analysis of big data.  Integrate different sources of information with spatial genomics data in statistical models to enrich the data reporting.  Develop graphical tools using statistical data visualization libraries to analyze the results.  Architect and implement new solutions and validate new ideas by modifying existing solutions or developing new features. 
 Calificaciones 
Requirements
 Proficiency in C++.  Proficiency in code optimization and parallel processing.  Proficiency in statistical modeling and analysis.  Advanced degree in Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or Computer Science (M.S. or Ph.D.) D. (preferred) or Masters with 5 years of experience. 
Additional Desirable Skills To Have
 Experience in Python Programming  Familiarity with data visualization libraries such as matplotlib, seaborn, pandas, etc.  A solid background in biology  Ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Adapts to changing priorities. Drive for results.  Embraces effective decision-making skills; uses good judgment and can bring closure to issues.  Continually demonstrates reliability and delivery of measured results, executed with a sense of urgency.  Desire to be part of a rapidly evolving organization, with compelling technology, and taking products and processes to the next level.  Good process and people skills.  Good business acumen with a positive solutions-oriented approach and ability to build productive relationships.

description:

title: Data Engineer (Python + AWS)
description:
¬°Hola! 
Si eres un apasionado/a del mundo del dato y est√°s en busca de un reto en proyectos internacionales, ¬°esta oferta es para ti!
En estos momentos estamos buscando incorporar al equipo un Data Engineer que realizar√° las siguientes funciones:

title: Data Engineer - SQL & Python (Hybrid, Barcelona) (Open)
description:
Gartner offers a hybrid, flexible environment, with remote work that allows associates great flexibility to work from home, and opportunities to connect with colleagues for moments that matter on-site. Candidates that apply should be located within a reasonable proximity to one of Gartner‚Äôs Centers of Excellence office locations.
About Gartner IT: 
Join a world-class team of skilled engineers who build creative digital solutions to support our colleagues and clients. We make a broad organizational impact by delivering cutting-edge technology solutions that power Gartner. Gartner IT values its culture of nonstop innovation, an outcome-driven approach to success, and the notion that great ideas can come from anyone on the team.
About The Role
This is a unique opportunity for a systematic, creative, and experienced individual to make a big impact on Gartner‚Äôs client experience. We are looking for a results-driven, self-motivated problem solver who can shape data management at Gartner. As a Senior Data Engineer, you will help operate our data platform and identify opportunities to innovate and drive value.
What you will do: 
Develop, troubleshoot, and maintain SQL code independently for intermediate to complex procedures in Oracle and Postgres environmentsAssist with migration from Oracle to PostgresAssist in the development, maintenance, and support of backend databasesTroubleshoot data issues, assist with ad-hoc requestsCollaborate with microservices teams to drive data design and integrationCreate self-service data applications using frameworks such as Streamlit so common requests do not need manual interventionAutomate repeatable tasks using Python
What you will need: 
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in math, statistics, engineering, or a related field required5+ years of Information Technology experienceProficiency in SQL to perform data loads, data extracts and conversionAbility to optimize SQL queries for performance by understanding the data model and using the right tables effectivelySome experience with PythonExperience with Agile scrumAbility to multi-task, work efficiently under pressure in a fast-paced environmentAbility to influence and sell ideas to colleagues, supervisor and managementAbility and willingness to continue to expand knowledge and experience
What you will get: 
Competitive compensation packages. 23 days annual holiday. Private Medical and Dental Care. Life and Disability Insurance. Public Transport Subsidy. Ticket Restaurant Card. Childcare Vouchers (Ticket Guarderia). IncentiFit - annual reimbursement for health-and-wellness-related activities. Pension Scheme. Tuition Reimbursement. Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Employee Assistance Program. Gartner Gives Charity Match. Relocation Assistance - a specialist to help you with all the appointments and paperwork. Limitless growth and learning opportunities. A collaborative and positive culture - join a diverse team of professionals that are as smart and driven as you. A chance to make an impact ‚Äì your work will contribute directly to our strategy. Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities. Hybrid environment with flexibility and more. New offices close to Gl√≤ries and the beach in the fantastic, ‚Äúinnovation and tech‚Äù 22@ district of sunny Barcelona. Fresh fruit, snacks, selection of teas, fair trade organic coffee and a fridge full of beer for our Thursday Beer O‚ÄôClock. 
PLEASE NOTE:
 Applications must be submitted in English.  A valid EU visa/passport is required for this position. 
#Technology
Who are we?
Gartner delivers actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization‚Äôs mission-critical priorities. We‚Äôve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?
Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger‚Äîas individuals, as communities and as an organization. That‚Äôs why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World‚Äôs Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner
What we offer:
Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you‚Äôll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.
The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

title: Sales Data and Reporting Manager
description:
About the role: 
This a critical role in our ongoing transformation of the Sales force delivering ~$5B annual revenue growing at double digits. We are looking for someone that can help us drive sales productivity through innovative technology solutions that will generate accurate data and analytics usage of CRM across 7000+ Sales associates. The right person is effective at developing trust-based relationships and move towards the important vs. the interesting. Having a strong goal-orientation (vs. a task-orientation) and deep empathy will help you navigate our organization to create distinctive value for Sales while strengthening your internal brand and career growth. If you are excited about the challenge of driving strategy within a fast-moving environment - this is the role for you!
What you will do:Product Manager of the technical solution that help Sales Managers and Leaders effectively manage their businesses and reinforce the global adoption of programs proven to drive productivity. title: Data Scientist
description:
Wallapop is a Barcelona based scale-up driven by the purpose to empower people to embrace a more conscious and human way of consumption. We believe in a world where collaborative economy is mainstream. This is what drives us. üí´
Wallapop operates in Spain, Italy and Portugal, offering a catalogue of several hundreds of millions of products and services. Powered by technical innovation and continuous improvement, we bring together the scale & trust of classifieds with the marketplace's convenience & reach. üå± Our mission is to enable a connected trade ecosystem, making 2nd-hand the norm through smart use of technology.
Backed by top investors such as Accel, Insight Partners & Naver Corp we bring our total valuation to 690 million EUR and are embarking on our international journey with the aim to become the world's best unique goods trading platform.
The Challenge üß©
The Wallapop platform generates tons of data and, with a mature data infrastructure already in place, the area of Data Science and Machine Learning is gaining momentum. The team is experiencing significant growth and, with many initiatives down the road, the opportunities are endless.
As a Data Scientist in the Wallapop Search team, you will be working on the Data Science and Machine Learning initiatives aimed to improve the Search experience of our users. Your work will contribute towards improving the retrieval and ranking of Wallapop's Search Engine, by dealing with the challenges resulting from user-generated content, multi-country and multi-language search, the unicity and sparsity of our catalog, and catering to the vast amount different user intents.
You will work closely with other Data Scientists, Product Managers, Engineers, UX Researchers and Analysts to understand the product requirements and explore possible data and ML solutions. You will own the whole product lifecycle, from gathering the data needed, to prototyping, building, evaluating and iterating end-to-end solutions, all within Wallapop's Data and ML Platforms.
Additionally, you will have the opportunity to work on internal research projects, exploring new technologies and building PoCs that could ultimately become data products or insights, and be valuable for Wallapop.
You will be part of a growing Machine Learning team (7+) within the Data & Analytics department (30+).
What You Will Do üëá
Take responsibility for the Data Science and ML initiatives in the Search domain. Work with a multidisciplinary team to identify opportunities and gather requirements (both in terms of product and tech). Work with a team of Data Scientists and Software Engineers to explore and build the best performance and scalable solutions. Take ownership of the complete Data Science and Machine Learning workflow: ideation, data processing (ETL), modeling, testing, deployment, monitoring and iteration. Proactively suggest, research and prototype new ideas for data and ML solutions. 
What We're Looking For üîé
Bachelor or MsC degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, or another quantitative field. Good understanding of ML concepts and techniques, and the whole ML development lifecycle. Experience building complex data products and ML solutions to real-life problems in a production-oriented environment, identifying the right techniques to solve the problem at hand. High interest in the Search or Recommender Systems domains. Strong coding skills (Python is a must, but other languages are also valued), capable of building robust data and ML software. Experience with common libraries and frameworks such as Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch. Advanced in SQL, capable of getting the data required from the appropriate sources, and building and maintaining data pipelines if needed (experience in tools such as Airflow or DBT would be a plus). Analytical and rigorous mindset, but also innovative and proactive, with autonomy and a team-player attitude. Fluent communication skills in English (both written and spoken), capable of explaining complex concepts to peers and stakeholders. 
What Would Be A Plus üöÄ
Experience working in the Search or Recommender Systems domains, and a good understanding of the concepts and metrics in Information Retrieval. More specifically, experience tackling challenges like Retrieval, Ranking (Learning-to-Rank), NER, Query Understanding, Query Relaxation, etc, and familiarity with open source Search Engines such as SolR, Elastic Search, Lucene, etc. Experience working within eCommerce or Marketplace domain, or in a product-tech company. Experience working within the AWS cloud (Redshift, S3, Lambda), and with cloud MLaaS solutions such as Amazon SageMaker (preferably), but also Google Vertex AI, Microsoft Azure ML, and other MLOps tools (Kubeflow, MLflow, etc). Familiarity with MLOps philosophy. Experience working with Big Data technologies (Spark)Experience with data visualization tools (Looker, Amplitude, Tableau, or others).. Fluent in any of the main languages present in Wallapop: Spanish, Italian, Portuguese. 
Do note that all our jobs are üìç Barcelona based. We work in a mostly remote capacity offering great flexibility to our employees, but we believe in the power of getting together regularly in our office. As a first iteration, we expect a 4+ day/month office attendance for which the specifics are decided on a team level.
Wallapop is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees as we want Wallapop to be a place for everyone.
We sponsor visa processes for international candidates when applicable and provide legal & admin support along the process combined with a competitive relocation package.
Additionally to the opportunity to contribute to an agile product set up and work together towards achieving our meaningful mission, we offer the following üç≠ Perks & Benefits:
Competitive phantom shares package for all employeesGenerous individual learning budget of 2k per yearGroup and individual English & Spanish lessons as part of our working dayPrivate Health Insurance with CignaFlexible working hours + short FridaysFlexible remuneration to deduct from gross salary (kindergarten/food/transport check)Gym & Wellness plan, including physiotherapist in the officeGenerous referral Program & Charity DonationExtended newborn & adoption leaveBonus for weddings & newbornsWallapop Renta (Tax income support)Monthly plan for free shipping, bumps & home-pick-up on our servicesWorkiversary Gifts and Birthday SurprisesContribution towards your WIFI in your monthly payrollOne-off payment based on compensation package to go towards setting up your home officeRelocation package (monetary support and legal advice) and visa sponsorship, if applicable26 holidays per yearTOP hardware of your choice (latest Apple or Windows)
What does the hiring process for this position look like? üëÄ **Please, note that all interviews take place remotely over hangouts.**
Intro Call - run by talent acquisition, focus on providing more information about the role and the company as well as going over your experience, motivation and expectations. This usually takes 45-60 minutes.
Task - you will be assigned a task to submit within 5 up to 7 days where you will be able to showcase your expertise and technical skills required for the role.
Expertise Interview - run by the hiring team, focus on the required core skills and the ability to deliver in a given context. This usually takes 60-90 minutes.
Stakeholder Interview - run by relevant stakeholders reflecting the reality of the context of the role, focus on the ability to collaborate & deliver in a cross-functional set-up. This usually takes 60 minutes.
Culture-Add Interview - run by culture interviewers, focus on adherence to Wallapop's purpose and business proposition. This usually takes 60 minutes.
Offer - should you be the right candidate, your offer will be discussed over a call with talent acquisition and will then be confirmed in writing.

title: Senior Product Data Scientist (they/she/he)
description:
About Glovo
We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.
At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!
We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.
In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
Be Part Of a Team Where You Will
Work closely with multi-disciplinary teams to define the product roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.Translate product questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.Foster strong relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.
You Have
2-5 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in product facing teams.Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in the following areas: supervised and unsupervised learning, game theory, statistical inference, bayesian statistics, causal inference, time series analysis, decision theory, mathematical optimisation.Demonstrable experience at productionising ideas; from conception to deployment.Experience with event instrumentation definition and management, ingestion (Amplitude, MixPanel, Heap or similar) and translating user behavior analytics into actionable insights. Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, Switchback, etc).Strong presentation and communication skills. Fluent spoken and written English.
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Competitive Pay and Enticing Equity plan Top-notch private health insurance Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products Zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Discounted gym memberships Flexible time off (take the time you need) Flexible working model - Combining 2 days a week working from home and up to 3 weeks a year working from abroad Enhanced parental leave including nursery support External learning opportunities Office fun activities from drinks to cinema nights! 
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly Care: Uplift people and the planet Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning Glownership: Act as proud owners High Bar: Focus on Top Performance 
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!
Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!
Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee.
For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Desde Claire Joster, firma de selecci√≥n especializada en perfiles tecnol√≥gicos , buscamos un Senior Data Engineer para nuestro cliente, empresa especializada desde hace 23 a√±os en an√°lisis Forex.
