title: Senior Data Engineer
location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
description:
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our data engineering team. If you are passionate about solving problems and making improvements through data and technology, we are eager to talk to you. The ideal candidate has both a willingness and desire to work in a dynamic environment, is able to apply Agile methodologies in day-to-day activities, and is a self-motivated developer who also enjoys working in a team environment. Our people have a creative, innovative, fun, and collaborative attitude, and are dedicated to creating new and valuable solutions for HP.

The Senior Data Engineer applies advanced subject matter knowledge to solve complex business issues and is regarded as a subject matter expert. Frequently contributes to the development of new ideas and methods. Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors. Leads and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and may participate in cross-functional initiatives. Acts as an expert providing direction and guidance to process improvements and establishing policies. Frequently represents the organization to external customers/clients. Exercises significant independent judgment within broadly defined policies and practices to determine the best method for accomplishing work and achieving objectives. May provide mentoring and guidance to lower-level employees.

Responsibilities

You will design, develop, test, modify, deploy, and document solutions and services in both local and cloud-based deployments of our Big Data infrastructure. Create solutions using current programming languages and tools and interact with team members, customers, and partners to define requirements. Collaborate with stakeholders and data scientists to analyze, extract, and report meaningful insights from data collected.

A Senior Data Engineer
Provides core contributions to multiple products, projects, solutions and processes through all stages of the development lifecycle including but not limited to design, analysis, coding, testing and integration.Is a highly skilled technical leader responsible for key system areas and ensures that changes are delivered with high quality and that best practices are used.May lead cross-team or cross-organization technical efforts related to the application design and development.Reviews and evaluates designs and project activities for compliance with applications design and development guidelines and standards; provides tangible feedback to improve product quality and mitigate failure risk.Provides domain-specific expertise and overall software leadership and perspective to cross-organization projects, programs, and activities.Drives innovation and integration of new technologies into projects and activities in the software applications design organization.Provides guidance and mentoring to less-experienced staff members.Participates in analyzing requirements and high-level designs.Implements, tests, and maintains software modules created.Participates in code reviews.Gives input to management on task duration estimates, technical information, and issue resolution.Provides domain-specific expertise and perspective to partners.Maintains awareness of new tools, environments, and methodologies being used in the Big Data space.Recommends ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality.Develops processes for data modeling, mining, and reporting.Researches opportunities for acquiring new data and new uses for existing data.
Qualifications
Typically 5+ years of experience in software or data engineering.Extensive experience in data modeling, data integration and processing of structured and unstructured data.Proficient in one or more programming languages (Python preferred).Strong SQL proficiency (experience with NoSQL ‚Äì advantage).Experienced with Apache SparkExcellent communication skills; mastery in English and local language.Ability to effectively communicate product architectures, design and change proposals.
Additional Preferred Qualifications / Advantages
DatabricksPandasDataikuFamiliar with best practices of the data and software engineering lifecycle and/or best practices of the above platforms and tools.Scala
This position is open for multiple locations and HP sites world wide.

About HP

You‚Äôre out to reimagine and reinvent what‚Äôs possible‚Äîin your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what‚Äôs next. We‚Äôre in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion ‚Äì it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you‚Äôre more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

title: Product Data Analyst - Logistics - Supply&Demand (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo
We are a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.
At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!
We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.
In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
Your Work-life Opportunity
You will be joining the Supply and Demand Balance team within the Logistics cluster. It is a product team responsible for ensuring the healthy marketplace at all times and operational conditions through different levers (availability of the restaurants, availability and incentives for couriers, etc). The team leverages operations research techniques, optimization and machine learning models to build tools that support the health of the marketplace. It is a combined team of software developers, data scientists, data analysts and product managers that work closely together and leverage their expertise to bring the highest value features to the platform.
Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Work closely with product managers and development teams to define the product roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (A/B test, multivariate test, clustering, supervised learning, etc) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.Translate product questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.Owning everything analytics end to end in the product development cycle, from ideation and opportunity sizing to experimentation and post-launch impact analyses.Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.Collaborate with data science projects development through exploration analysis, proof of concepts ML models and experimentation.
You Have
1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in product facing teamsExperience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide product-shaping insightsExcellent SQL skillsSolid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R MarkdownDemonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, QlikviewGood understanding of software development and agile methodologies is a plusKnowledge or experience in digital product development is a plusExcellent spoken and written English
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Competitive Pay and Enticing Equity plan Top-notch private health insuranceMonthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products Zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Discounted gym memberships Flexible time off (take the time you need) Flexible working model - Combining 2 days a week working from home and up to 3 weeks a year working from abroadEnhanced parental leave including nursery supportWellbeing via free online therapy and emotional support solutions External learning opportunities Office fun activities from drinks to cinema nights! 
What You'll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quicklyCare: Uplift people and the planetGood Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!
Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!
Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee.
For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: ESG Data Operations Senior Manager
description:
Clarity AI‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!
We are looking for an ESG Data Operations Senior Manager to join our Data Strategy team.You will be responsible for streamlining the data collection processes and coordinating the team that lead Clarity AI to have best-in-class data coverage and quality.
The first key aspect of our success is leveraging technology. We have built tools that enable fast data collection, along with the most efficient built-in quality controls. You will be in charge of ensuring that these tools continue to evolve and stay up-to-date with the fast-paced industry and overall technological advancements.
The second key aspect to our success is our people. You will be in charge of managing a team of sustainability specialists. This includes coaching, mentoring, engaging and promoting the team internally in order for them to have a successful career at Clarity.If you have worked in similar roles in the industry and want to bring your expertise and energy to a company in which you can leverage technology to create innovative data enabled products, we are looking for you.

LOCATION:Spain, remote
KEY RESPONSIBILITIESOperations: Build and manage daily data collection operations and processesDelivery. Deliver against the company data collection plan, not only on the underlying data but also on the data products Clarity AI creates from raw dataManagement Manage a team of data analysts, and work with the product team to enhance data collection tools. Be instrumental in defining career and learning paths and drive internal talent.Reporting Define KPIs for data collection, data quality and the broader document collection and analysis workflow to enable performance transparency, reporting, and process optimization. Own regular reporting on progress against the collection roadmap.Collaboration Effectively collaborate and communicate with vertical and lateral stakeholders on process updates, challenges, and highlights. In particular, work with other product and strategy teams across the business to ensure that the quality of our data meets client expectations, and with the technology areas in order to successfully increase automation.Strategy Participate in the ESG leadership team to influence broader strategic product priorities and research and development efforts. Provide thought leadership as well as operational leadership.

Requirements: We like Leaders who are able to execute against objectives, providing visibility on KPIs related to coverage, quality and efficiency. We like dynamic people that want to create new things, teams, processes with innovative approaches and who are not afraid of taking risks.
You enjoy building scalable processes and teams with a deep understanding on how technology can streamline and accelerate those processes.
As the ideal candidate for the position you will provideYou hold an MBA in Business Administration and a business or technical background (Business, Engineer, Math, Physics, ‚Ä¶ ) If you have a business degree, you have strong analytical skills.You have at least 10 years of experience in a Data Vendor or as a data consumer in a financial institution. You have at least 5 years of direct people management experience.You have hands-on experience with corporate actions management, financial reference data. Direct experience working with ESG data is strongly preferred.You are hands-on. Strong conceptual, technical (Excel, python & SQL) and analytical skills, particularly in the areas of quantitative research, analysis and data management;You have direct experience building and executing data management business processes covering topics such as data quality, vendor management, methodology alignment and service level agreements.Leadership skills to coach, mentor and motivate a high performing team. Hands-on and leading by example.Strong vendor management experience to identify and source quality partners, set the right contractual frameworks and define service level parameters.Solutions- and execution-oriented approach;Good project management skills, attention to detail, a self-driven work ethic, and the ability to prioritize multiple tasks in a high-pressure, deadline-driven environmentAbility to work within a team-oriented cross-functional environment and communicate with various internal parties; experience working with teams located in multiple cities and countries preferred.You are able to implement processes and interact with different stakeholders in order to make those efficient and effective.You are comfortable interacting with customers and have a strong bias towards customer satisfaction and creation of value for the company.Strong communication skills. The right candidate can thrive in an environment of asynchronous conversation, since a part of the Clarity AI team will be based remotely. We expect you to have strong communication skills and be able to create working relationships with coworkers across various locations.You are fluent in English (C1)EU Work permit.
It will be a plus if you had:You are familiar with NLP technologies and have worked integrating technologies in research workflows.


Benefits: 
Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.Clarity‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences.We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. That's why we created our own ERG groups.Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That‚Äôs why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options.Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget.Additional benefits are available depending on your location.We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.
Clarity has received several awards:World Economic Forum PioneerOne of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation LabTop startup with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open TalentYoung Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017
Privacy PolicyResponsibility: Clarity AI Inc. 160 Greentree Drive, Suite 101, City of Dover, County of Kent, Delaware 19904, United States.Purpose: management of selection processes for new employees.Legitimation: necessary processing for contract execution.Recipients: company of the Clarity Group in the country that would carry out the contract or where position is being offered.Rights: the interested party may exercise the rights of access, rectification, opposition, limitation, suppression, portability and not to be the object of automated decisions according to the Privacy Policy.More info: to consult the privacy policy in detail, click on the following link (Privacy Policy)

title: Lead Data Scientist
description:
Opportunity Description

We are seeking a Principal Data Scientist with strongly developed expertise in graph-based AI and related technologies to maximize utilization of data and knowledge in data and digital transformation.

ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE:
Lead - Master‚Äôs degree in mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, statistics, economics, computational sciences or a related quantitative discipline and 5+ years of analytical experience in an industrial or commercial setting OR PhD degree with at least 3+ years of industry experienceDS- Master‚Äôs degree in mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, statistics, economics, computational sciences or a related quantitative discipline and 3+ years of analytical experience in an industrial or commercial setting OR PhD degree with industry experienceExperience AI/ML/NLP modelling of complex datasets.Advanced software development skills in at least two of the standard data science languages (such as Python, R, Scala, C++, Julia) and strong data manipulations skills (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, graph, etc.)Knowledge of SQL and relational databases, query authoring (SQL) and designing variety of databases (e.g. Postgres SQL)Comfortable working in cloud and high-performance compute environments (e.g. AWS, Apache Spark) Disciplined AI/ML deployment (MLOps, CI/CD) and Agile deliveryExperience in coordination of delivery teams and providing feedback to their managementExcellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, and consultancy skills

Additional required ‚Äì deep experience in one of these areas:
Graph- Experience AI/ML modelling of complex datasets, network analysis or direct experience in creating and maintaining graph data models. Experience with a variety of graph technologies Knowledge of graph databases like Neo4J (Cypher, causal clusters), JanusGraph (Gremlin, GraphML), AWS Neptune, OrientDB. xpertise in machine learning/deep learning-based graph algorithms relevant to link prediction, ranking/recommendation, completion, community detection, node embedding, etc.Familiarity with Deep Learning, neural network architectures including CNNs, RNNs, Embeddings, Transfer Learning, Attention-based Networks, Statistical Learning, Restricted Boltzmann Machines (RBMs), Belief Networks, and Reinforcement LearningDeep experience in developing models for private sector or industrial setting e.g.

Requirements

Lead Data Scientist Responsibilities:
Lead data science area deliverables for digital products / programs / initiatives including the allocation of work within the team, monitors the quantitative and qualitative achievements of the team, and reports resultsWork as an individual contributor, providing data science expertise to digital products / programs / initiatives.Apply in-depth experience with both statistical and modern data science approaches, including unsupervised, supervised, regression algorithms.Apply advanced techniques such as neural networks, deep learning, NLP and federated learning.Build models, algorithms, simulations and experiments by writing highly optimized code and using state-of-the art machine learning technologies.Collaborate cross-functionally in teams involved in data driven analytics to maximize impact of graph-based capabilitiesBuild and manage support models incorporated into digital or AI products; Work with Infrastructure and Ops teams to ensure appropriate architecture and toolingCapacity to mentor junior personnelBe able to apply in-depth experience with both statistical and modern data science approaches to business cases and knowledge management tasksStrong written and verbal communication skills - ability to communicate complex ideas up to people of varying technical skillsWork with developers, engineers, and MLOps to deliver AI/ML solutions for new products/services

title: Junior Big Data Engineer (Tech Support) - Google Cloud Platform
description:
WHAT WE LOOK FOR
Are you looking forward to being a Cloud Engineer? Do you think it could be interesting to learn the top notch technologies available from Google‚Äôs internal point of view? Would you like to learn every single bit of the cloud systems and how Big Data works on the top Companies worldwide? In this case please keep reading as we are looking for a talented Cloud Data Engineer with a deep understanding of Python/Java to join our young and international team based in Barcelona.
Companies all around the world rely on Google Cloud! Here your main responsibility will be to provide outstanding technical support for the most prestigious Google Cloud clients.
As part of our team you will be responsible of providing high level technical support to BigData products and ETL processes ranging from Orchestration (such as Airflow/Kubernetes) to parallel processing frameworks (such as Spark, Hadoop, Beam) to relational databases for analysis (SQL) among other technologies closely related to Artificial Intelligence (such as Machine Learning applications) to worldwide clients while gathering feedback to help improve the Cloud Platform products, which will boost your IT career into the next level.
Minimum requirements:
100% fluent in English.European citizenship or work permit in SpainBachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, software/computer engineering, or applicable work experience.Experience with Linux/UNIXUnderstanding of basic web technologies (e.g. TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP, etc.).In-depth programming skills in Python or JavaExperience with relational SQL and NoSQL databasesUnderstanding of streaming data architectures and technologies for real-time data processing
Desirable skills:
Data warehousing and ETL ToolsExperience with big data tools (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, HBase, etc.)Experience in Machine LearningExperience with code repositoriesExperience with cloud providers (Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure)
WHAT YOU WILL GET
Permanent contractFull time position (39 hours / week)Salary package: 30.040‚Ç¨ gross/year (25.000 as base salary + 3.000 as bonus + 1.540 ticket restaurant + private health insurance valued approximately 500‚Ç¨)Salary review after one yearTwo months of paid training!Learning is the key to success. title: Data Analyst Coches.net
description:
We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.
We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.
Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for an exceptional Senior Data Engineer to join the Coches.Net and Motos.Net team. You will work as a member of the vertical Motor team, collaborating closely with Product owners, cluster teams, data engineers and management team stake-holders (Marketing, Sales, Product, BizDev and other Operations teams). Your main mission is to make sure our data flow are correct and executed on time in order to identify trends, opportunities and problems to improve the offering and services we offer. These will be your functions:
 Create and evolve our data proceses using multiple technologies common to digital analytics ecosystem Identify, analyse and interpret KPIs and Health Metrics related to our users and customers, creating dashboard and visualisation to monitor them. Actively participate in the discovery, and development of advanced analytical models (such as clustering, and predictive models), into their implementation in business use cases, such as customer segmentation, and propensity models for upselling, downselling, and churn prediction.5+ years of experience in eCommerce, an online company. Advanced knowledge of SQL and relational databases Experience with big data technology (e.g. databricks, datalakes) Some knowledge of data engineering tools (e.g. Airflow, DBT) Advanced knowledge of Python and/or R for data analysis (e.g. pandas, numpy, matplotlib), and advanced analytics (e.g. scikit-learn) Good knowledge of basic machine learning algorithms (e.g. clustering, classification, regressions)
Nice-to-have
 Advanced user of at least one visualisation tool such as Tableau and/or QlikSense. Analytical skills: know how to interpret data, to extract relevant insights and be able to translate business questions into analytical needs Experience working with sales, operations, and strategy teams.At Adevinta Spain, we believe in the power of a fair and equitable benefits policy. And we do everything we can to make it so. Therefore, we pay special attention to all aspects that are key in your day-to-day life:Our work model prioritizes remote work combined with face-to-face dynamics in the office that help us connect and make strategic decisions as a team. There are a minimum of 5 face-to-face days per quarter that you will pick with your team, that is, a minimum of 20 days a year, of which there are 8 days that we have chosen for everyone because they are meetings that reinforce our culture as a company (development conversations with managers, the creation of objectives or the summer celebration and Christmas party)Furthermore, you have the option of working up to four weeks a year from wherever you'd like. To do this, you must have a good internet connection and be able to follow the team's schedules.Every year we engage in benchmarking against the external market in order to create competitive compensation packages. Moreover, we do have plans that allow you to "flex your gross salary" in order to purchase benefits such as meal vouchers, commuters card, training and child care.We have Apple, Dell and Samsung options to choose the hardware that helps you most in your daily life. Choose between a Macbook Pro (14" or 16") or Lenovo X1 laptop and an iPhone 12 or Samsung S21 phone. Do you travel by car or motorcycle? We subsidize part of the parking costYour well-being is our priority. We cover fully for your medical insurance and we allow family members to be added to the policy for a discounted price.At the Barcelona office, you can enjoy sessions of 1 hour of physiotherapy Do you like going to the gym? We sponsor 70% of the monthly fee of your chosen centre/ studio and we have agreements with both Andjoy and McFit for discounted membership prices. We enjoy 23 days of paid-time-off a year.We offer free breakfast and drinks at our Barcelona office every day of the week. You can also choose to enjoy the freshmade set daily menu in our canteen for an economical price. In Madrid on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays you can enjoy free breakfast.Last but not least, you have 5 extra days to attend conferences and we offer one entrance ticket per year.
Benefits
Competitive compensation packageOpportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisationBenefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plansFlexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computerSmart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more
EN: Flexible benefits programme (transport, restaurants, child-care, etc), Free daily breakfast, 26 days of holidayPrograma flexible de prestaciones (transporte, restaurantes, guarder√≠a, etc.), Desayuno diario gratuito, 26 d√≠as de vacaciones
Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.
If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

title: üîé Data Scientist | Digital company based in lively Barcelona
company: Prometeo Talent | High-quality HR & recruitment services
description:
Ofertia is a digital company based in lively Barcelona. Our mission is to revolutionize the way people do shopping, covering the gap between the online and offline shopping worlds. We help retailers to drive more customers to their stores by publishing digital circulars on our mobile apps and web portals, where consumers can find the best offers from their favorite stores around them. Ofertia is now part of the Mediapost Group with a strong presence in Spain. Moreover, we operate in Mexico, Colombia, and Sweden.
What makes working at Ofertia great
The opportunity to bring our IT platform to the next level.Ofertia is one of the most exciting digital companies in the heart of Barcelona with a disruptive product.We support your personal and professional development with challenging projects and training programs.Flexible working hours and the possibility to work 100% remotely (within Spain).A company culture is driven by pioneer thinking and talent that crosses departments through flat hierarchies and short communication channels.
Project
This well-known app for brands, retailers, and consumers is looking for an experienced Data Scientist (m/f) who is, like them, passionate about delivering the best product and user experience to our customers. As a key member of their cross-functional and agile team setup, you will leverage your skills and ability to extract valuable insights from various data sets. You will work with a variety of challenges that touch all parts of the business. Their goal is to design a better product that customers will love, enabling them to get meaningful data for them to make the most accurate decisions.
Role
Identify the best state-of-the-art algorithms and libraries to solve complex problems.Ad-hoc data analysis to answer critical business questions and to identify potential growth and development opportunities.Enriching the company‚Äôs data with third-party information when needed.Improving data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building better analytic systems.Collaborate and contribute to functional, cross-functional groups, initiatives on methodologies, innovations, technology, IT infrastructure, etc. to enable broader and more effective use of data.Improve our internal data science tools and frameworks.
Qualifications
Strong programming skills in Python3+ years of prior experience in a Data Scientist role including statistical modeling, simulation, and analysis, machine learning algorithms like predictions, recommendations, object recognitionGood knowledge and experience in image recognition, text extraction algorithms Good knowledge of libraries like Pandas, PuLP, Matplotlib, seaborn, sci-kit-learnExperience working with Linear Programming and Mixed-Integer Linear ProgrammingExperience with TensorFlow 2Good knowledge of SQLComfortable with Data Engineering skillsGood knowledge of AWS Services like EC2, S3, Data PipelineBasic knowledge of third-party API integration to read data from external sourcesExperience in executing data science projects
Personal Skills
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, able to explain complex effects and impacts of ML/DL insights in simple business termsEntrepreneurial mindset, self-starter, and ability to operate independently

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Hybrid Intelligence, a Capgemini Engineering team, is looking for a SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST to join the team in Spain. You will provide analytics expertise to a highly talented team, while participating in the rapid growth and expansion of our client base.

A Masters or PhD in operations research, computer science, mathematics or engineering with more than four years of experience in DS projects.Professional experience applying data science, analytics, machine learning and computational techniques. (Python, Pandas, Keras, Pytorch, Tensorflow)A genuine enthusiasm for using data science to solve complex problems, and an understanding of the algorithms, data processing methods and visualization techniques required.It will valued real experience in Cloud Environment (AWS, Azure, ..)Excellent communication and presentation skills, and the ability to explain complex concepts.Professional level ability in Spanish and English.

As a member of the Hybrid Intelligence team of Capgemini Engineering you will work on a variety of innovative and rewarding projects that make a difference. Professional development plan, based on your experience and future potential, adapted to you, with both horizontal and vertical growth.

Our commitment to inclusion and equal opportunities means that we have an Equality Plan and a Code of Ethics that guarantee the professional development of the workforce and equal opportunities in their selection within an environment free of discrimination based on ethnicity, nationality, social origin, age, sexual orientation, gender expression, religion or any other personal, physical or social circumstance.

title: Director of Data
description:
Are you an experienced data expert looking to guide a thriving Barcelona based start up by leading a mix of data teams to establish, refine, and revolutionise their data systems?
This is an incredible opportunity for an ambitious, driven data analyst, engineer, or scientist to take the next step in your career and step into higher leadership at the fastest growing delivery player in Europe, Central Asia, and Africa. In 2022 alone, this company received 10 million orders across 260,000 partners, they have exploded into the market and are set to grow exponentially into 2023, offering a wealth of opportunity for the future.
Position Overview
You will lead five teams of data engineers, data scientists, and product& data analysts to make the marketplace a personal, data driven environment. This company generates value from user behaviour data and are acutely aware of the value of their data teams.
Key Responsibilities
You will prioritise the scope, staff, and safeguarding of vital projects across the company's business with board-level visibility.You will be a leading voice on road maps, knowing the right balance to deliver reliable whilst maintaining a good balance of speed and quality.You will be a voice for innovation in an environment that values your ability to deliver insights and automated decision support across customer and partner-facing apps.You will be hands on with innovative technologies such as Generative AI and will ensure continuous learning through experimentation at scale.Cultivate a thriving culture of ownership, innovation, and mastery of purpose within your teams to drive a data-driven culture across the company.
Requirements
You will have hands on experience as either a data scientist, engineer, or analyst and will be educated on the most recent developments in these areas, with this company's data stack being AWS, Python, Spark, Trino/Starburst, DBT, Looker and Amplitude among others.Must bring leadership experience of guiding teams of 5-7 experts in an agile environment, with the confidence to take this further.Must be experienced in guiding multi-craft teams to deliver production-ready data pipelines and data science models and company-wide insights.Influenced both product and business stakeholders on Director level (and above) MS/BS in quantitative fieldExperience in marketplace dynamics and how data can impact platform or E-commerce business is a plus.Must be experienced delivering impactful data products fast with attention to detail, the ability to look at solutions in creative and unconventional ways, recognise opportunities to innovate and engage stakeholders in vision and strategy.
If you are interested in the opportunity to champion data processes whilst leading a series of teams to success at a thriving leader in the Food Delivery marketplace, please apply by submitting your CV through this advertisement.

title: Senior Data Architect
description:
Senior Data Architect ‚Äì Data-led Consultancy ‚Äì up to 100,000‚Ç¨Location: BarcelonaFlexibility: Hybrid (1 day in office)
We are working with a leading global Google Cloud Partner looking for a Senior Data Architect to join their team in Barcelona!
About the companyThey are a data-led consultancy providing businesses with cutting-edge data and AI solutions by partnering with Google Cloud to help their clients future-proof their solutions, better understand their consumers, unlock their operational efficiencies, and increase their competitive advantage.
Their team is formed of diverse talent consisting of experts in a variety of fields such as architecture, machine learning, business intelligence and data engineering. They all share a passion for data and believe in a pragmatic approach to solving complex problems.

About YouThey are currently seeking Data Architects who have a strong background in Google Cloud and a passion for data.

Nice to have:Proficiency in Python.Exposure to DBT.Exposure to Looker.Previous experience working in a consultancy or similar.
BenefitsLearning and development budget!Health and wellbeing benefits!Flexible working model!A personalised development plan to ensure you can reach your professional goals!
If you are an individual with strong data architecture background working with Google Cloud and are interested in working with a leading data consultancy then apply to this advert or email your CV vega@weareorbis.com.

title: Junior Data Scientist
location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
description:

title: Data Quality Steward
location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
description:
Descripci√≥n - Externa
At Boehringer Ingelheim we develop breakthrough therapies that improve the lives of both humans and animals. Founded in 1885 and family-owned ever since, Boehringer Ingelheim takes a long-term perspective.Now, we are powered by 52,000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture. We believe that if we have talented and ambitious people who are passionate about innovation, there is no limit to what we can achieve. GTM Data Quality StewardThe Data, platforms and integrations (DP&I) team is a E2E data oriented team consisting of Data stewards, platform managers and Data Quality Specialists. All these roles work together to get our marketing data for both medical and commercial in optimal shape.As a Global Data Quality Steward, your role is defined as a coordinating role between capability owners, business stakeholders in regions and countries and IT.
Tasks and responsibilities 
Draw data models and data flows that describe and explain the data architecture and data integrationExplain data flows (in English) to as well business as IT. Your role is orchestrating the work between Business and IT when it comes to data excellenceSupport the IDP Coordinator on improving, promoting and communicating the DP&I strategy and helping the company in becoming more data literate.Present to stakeholders the bigger picture (overall concepts) without losing touch with specific technical details. For this a solid technical background is a requirementYour main responsibility is getting things done to improve overall data quality. 
Requirements Bachelor's degree in mathematics, economics or similarExperience working in cross functional teams with an agile mindset.Knowledge of relational and non-relational databases / data structuresUnderstanding of data compliance in the pharmaceutical industryExperience in Veeva CRM (frontend user + backend data)Language: Fluency in oral and written English; further language skills would be an asset.Skilled in SQL, Tableau and data visualization techniques.Knowledge of data governance principles and practices.Experience with cloud-based data platforms, such as AWS or Microsoft Azure.Experience in the pharmaceutical industry is a plus  #IamBoehringerIngelheim because‚Ä¶ 
With us, you can grow, collaborate, innovate and improve lives. We offer challenging work in a respectful and friendly global working environment surrounded by a world of innovation driven mindsets and practices. In addition, flexible learning and continuous development for all employees is key, because your growth is our growth. 
We are continuously working to create a great employee experience. These are some examples of how we will take care of you: 
Flexible working conditions Life and accident insurance Health insurance at a competitive price Investment in your learning and development Gym membership discounts  If you have read until here, what are you waiting to apply? We want to know more about you!

title: Senior Director of First-Party Data Strategy
description:
Craft:
Data, Analytics & Strategy
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Director of First-Party Data Strategy to join our Central Insights team in Barcelona. This role will be responsible for leading the development, execution, and evolution of our company's first-party data strategy, ensuring it aligns with our overall business objectives. The ideal candidate is an expert in first party data, data strategy, analytics, and privacy, with a proven track record of successfully driving data initiatives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Responsibilities:
Develop, implement, and maintain a comprehensive first-party data strategy and roadmap that supports the company's long-term goals and objectives. Identify and assess data opportunities across the organization, including new data sources, technologies, and partnerships, to enhance our games and player experiences. Develop actionable recommendations for data-driven strategic initiatives, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive the implementation and change management process. Support the building of strong data privacy and governance best practices, ensuring we‚Äôre industry leaders with regards with regulations and internal policies. Collaborate with key stakeholders, including product, marketing, and technology teams, to align data strategy with overall company goals and objectives. Continuously monitor and analyze the performance of data-driven initiatives, providing insights and recommendations for optimization and future growth. Keep abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data strategy, analytics, and privacy, to ensure the company remains at the forefront of the gaming industry. 
Requirements:
Strong experience in management consulting, strategy, program management, product management, or other cross-functional leadership roles in the gaming industryExperience working with machine learning / predictive modelingExcellent skills in financial modeling, advanced data analytics, and business case developmentDemonstrated ability to forge cross-functional partnerships, influence teams without formal authority, and lead through change. Outstanding written and oral presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex data concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences. Demonstrable ability to work in a dynamic environment with high ambiguity and adapt to changing priorities. Proven track record of operating effectively in cross-functional settings, working with stakeholders from a broad range of backgrounds and at all levels of the organization. Hands-on experience working in the mobile advertising business (supply or demand side) is a strong plus. Previous work experience in or exposure to one or more of the following sectors: mobile gaming, consumer mobile, consumer internet, marketing
About King
King is the game developer behind the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top-grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King‚Äôs games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malm√∂, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.
A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes
Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.
Making the World Playful
Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It‚Äôs what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid-core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we‚Äôre not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!
Applications need to be in English.
Discover King at careers.king.com

description:
At Boehringer Ingelheim we develop breakthrough therapies that improve the lives of both humans and animals. Founded in 1885 and family-owned ever since, Boehringer Ingelheim takes a long-term perspective.
Now, we are powered by 52,000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture. We believe that if we have talented and ambitious people who are passionate about innovation, there is no limit to what we can achieve. GTM Data Quality Steward
The Data, platforms and integrations (DP&I) team is a E2E data oriented team consisting of Data stewards, platform managers and Data Quality Specialists. All these roles work together to get our marketing data for both medical and commercial in optimal shape.As a Global Data Quality Steward, your role is defined as a coordinating role between capability owners, business stakeholders in regions and countries and IT.
Tasks and responsibilities 
Draw data models and data flows that describe and explain the data architecture and data integrationExplain data flows (in English) to as well business as IT. Your role is orchestrating the work between Business and IT when it comes to data excellenceSupport the IDP Coordinator on improving, promoting and communicating the DP&I strategy and helping the company in becoming more data literate.Present to stakeholders the bigger picture (overall concepts) without losing touch with specific technical details. For this a solid technical background is a requirementYour main responsibility is getting things done to improve overall data quality.

Requirements Bachelor's degree in mathematics, economics or similarKnowledge of relational and non-relational databases / data structuresExperience working in cross functional teams with an agile mindset.Knowledge of relational and non-relational databases / data structuresUnderstanding of data compliance in the pharmaceutical industryExperience in Veeva CRM (frontend user + backend data)Language: Fluency in oral and written English; further language skills would be an asset.Skilled in SQL, Tableau and data visualization techniques.Knowledge of data governance principles and practices.Experience with cloud-based data platforms, such as AWS or Microsoft Azure.Experience in the pharmaceutical industry #IamBoehringerIngelheim because‚Ä¶ 
With us, you can grow, collaborate, innovate and improve lives. We offer challenging work in a respectful and friendly global working environment surrounded by a world of innovation driven mindsets and practices. In addition, flexible learning and continuous development for all employees is key, because your growth is our growth. We are continuously working to create a great employee experience. These are some examples of how we will take care of you: 
Flexible working conditions Life and accident insurance Health insurance at a competitive price Investment in your learning and development Gym membership discounts 
If you have read until here, what are you waiting to apply? We want to know more about you!

title: Head of Go to Market (GTM) Data
description:
THE ROLE
Personio is growing rapidly. With that growth comes the increasing demand for data to support decision-making, set and track goals, predict the future and automate processes. In order to meet that demand, Data is on a mission to enable better decisions within the company.
Personio is looking for a Head of GTM Data with a strong track record of developing and evolving analytics capabilities and funnel optimization in alignment with the overall business goals and objectives. This position reports to the VP of Data and will be highly visible within the GTM executive and senior leadership teams.
As the head of this function, you have the opportunity to lead a team who is key in developing reports and providing insights around the marketing funnel (Return on Acquisition, Demand Gen Marketing performance, Account Based Marketing) and sales processes (revenue forecasting, performance to Quota).
The responsibility includes building the base foundation of the GTM data team (e.g KPI definition, reporting dimensions, etc.) and also enabling the team to apply advanced analytics models to optimize the performance of key GTM processes, with projects such as marketing attribution modeling (first touch, multi-touch, last touch), lead scoring, pricing strategies, and funnel optimization or opportunity scoring.
You will partner closely with our Marketing, Sales, and Leadership teams to align on goals, identify growth opportunities, and build strategy and operations to drive the growth of Personio. The GTM teams rely heavily on analytics to inform their data-driven decision-making processes, and the role requires excellent systems, analytical, and communication skills. Your data-driven acumen and experimentation mindset will be critical to our success, as we aim to innovate and scale our business.
Responsibilities: Insights: You and your team will generate actionable insights that enable our sales teams to make data-driven decisions and achieve our business goals. You will also own the build and presentation of clear narratives on sales performance in MBR/QBR formats to a broad audience.Reporting: You will be the subject matter expert in all sales and marketing processes and KPIs associated with them. You will be responsible to define and develop the reporting suite for the GTM team and enable them to self-serve for their daily activities.Leadership: You will lead, manage, and coach a team of data professionals, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and impact.Strategy: You will drive the creation and implementation of the analytical vision to closely align with the business needs in order to maximize efficiency and support the GTM growth. By proactively engaging with our executive team to communicate the impact and value of our data activities and insights, you will be expected to provide guidance for strategic and operational decision-making.Stakeholder management: You will collaborate closely with key stakeholders, including sales executives, sales and marketing process owners, and our central data team, to understand their needs, prioritize projects, communicate recommendations, and support their adoptionRole model: You will embody and promote our Personio values and culture (https://www.personio.com/about-personio/careers/culture/), leading by example and upholding high ethical and professional standards. You will inspire and motivate your team and colleagues to strive for excellence, growth, and impact, and to continuously learn and innovate.

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED
10+ years of experience working in and leading a Go-to-Market analytics team with a proven track record of driving impact.You have a background in a quantitative field such as computer science, business informatics, statistics, physics, or math.You have demonstrated experience and success in leading data teams that have delivered measurable business results through their insights and data products. You know to act as a mentor to support career progression.You have worked in a hyper-growth B2B SaaS business before, investment banking or consulting.You have experience working with executive-level business stakeholders and are able to concisely communicate and influence them.You have profound knowledge of Python and SQL, as well as experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools, such as Tableau or Power BI.You have strong knowledge of GTM operational software such as Salesforce or HubSpot and experience developing a data strategy based on those data sources.You have experience with A/B testing and experimentation methodologies and are able to implement a culture of experimentation to drive continuous improvement in sales and marketing processes

WHY PERSONO
Aside from our people, culture, and mission, there are a variety of additional benefits that help make Personio a great place to work! Work with us and receive:
Competitive compensation package ‚Äì reevaluated each year ‚Äì that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity28 days of paid vacation, plus another additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)2 Impact Days you can use to have an impact on the environment and society ‚Äì one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative! #SocialResponsibilityFind your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! We offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework to suit your needsAnnual personal development budget for you to invest in your development via professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and moreRegular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrationsHigh-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processesReceive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCaresSave money with corporate discounts across brands like Adidas, LG, Bosch, Apple, and moreChoose between green mobility options, including a bike lease covered by PersonioMonthly tax-free stipend of ‚Ç¨162 to help cover food and public transportation expenses (Cobee)Private health insurance (company level plan): Access to Sanitas plan at a reduced employee cost (‚Ç¨43 for employees, spouse, or children)Access multiple fitness studios and sports facilities across Spain for ‚Ç¨30 per month with a subsidized Gympass membershipFree English and Spanish language classes

ABOUT US
Bring your best. Make your mark. We‚Äôre using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.
With over 8,000 customers and a team of 1,700 in seven offices across Europe, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let‚Äôs build the future of HR technology together.
Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We #EmbraceUniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
Overview
Data Quality Analyst is a part of global transformational program which is fundamentally evolving our planning and reporting capabilities. This position will play a critical role in the success of the PepsiCo designed Mosaic program. Mosaic is transforming the way FP&A teams work across PepsiCo and the level of financial information available for the senior leadership teams.
The Analyst will be responsible for the development and execution of data quality plan, the understanding of data sources, systems, data flow to the solution and communication and explanation of business requirements to the IT teams, local markets support with any issues arising on master data front.
Responsibilities
Ensure Core Model is up to date with latest definitions (functional, global and regional).Align dimensions/elements with different business functions.Evaluate and understand link between dataset increasing potential business insights.Collaborate closely with IT/ Strategy & Transformation teams to ensure business requirements from Mosaic leads and Sector FP&A teams are well-understood and translated into the design.Gain knowledge on how data is being ‚Äúconsumed‚Äù by the end-users (support them with necessary training).Own full suite of master data sets used in financial planning (Product, Customer, GL, Cost Center).Present process understanding and monitor the data quality across markets.Provide guidance and help in getting local markets ready for data standardisation regardless of the origin and size of their data.Drive data quality improvements to ensure appropriate reporting capabilities are delivered as part of the project.
Qualifications
Previous experience in a similar position.Technical competencies across a variety of software (i.e. Tableau, Alteryx, SAP, Oracle, Power Steering, TM1 & Cognos).Familiarity with technical database structures and hierarchy.Ability to structure highly complex concepts into simple execution.Expertise and knowledge of database management principles and applications.Ability to navigate complex and varied processes across multiple markets.Willingness to engage at all levels of the organization.Strong written and verbal English.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Our opportunity 
At LiveWell, we are on a mission to make the world healthier, happier and more fulfilling by leveraging the power of data and AI. Our robust platform is dedicated to connecting people to the right wellness programs, activities, and services that best fit their unique needs.
In line with our vision to enhance our analytics capabilities and further our mission, we are currently seeking a skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic and collaborative team.
 Your role 
 As a  Data Scientist   your main responsibilities will involve: 

 Collaborate with product and engineering teams to bring personalization features to the platform.  Develop data preprocessing pipelines, machine-learning algorithms and deploy solutions in AWS.  Use data visualization tools to present information in an easy-to-understand manner.  Oversee the solutions deployed in the production environment to ensure optimal system functionality and performance. 

Your Skills And Experience
 As a Data Scientist your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

 2-3 years of experience in related field  Strong Python and software engineering skills. Using OOP principles is a must.  Deep knowledge of ML and its integration into products.  Familiarized with Docker and AWS.  Excellent skills with data visualization libraries.  Self-driven and proactive attitude.  Show a proven track record of your contributions using ML to real-life products and projects  Excellent engineering and scientific skills to solve the tough challenges which are faced in the industry. 

Additional Information
As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:

 Option to work remotely within Spain up to 80%  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Collective Life Retirement Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou. Please apply with your CV in English by clicking on the button ‚ÄúApply online‚Äù.
Who We Are
Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You‚Äôd give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It‚Äôs a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.
 Diversity & Inclusion 
At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.
So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.
You are the heart & soul of Zurich! 
At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?
We highly value the experience and know-how of our employees and offer a wide range of opportunities across business areas to encourage you to apply for new opportunities within Zurich when you are ready for your next career step.
Let‚Äôs continue to grow together!

Location(s): ES - Barcelona Remote working: HybridSchedule: Full TimeRecruiter name: Maria Eugenia Torres

title: Cloud Data Analyst Engineer (FinOps)
description:
Company Description
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We‚Äôve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions
empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high-value work they live for.
Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
Job Description
As a Cloud FinOps Engineer, you will work on analyzing various data streams - one of them being cloud spend accross Cloud platforms, identify potential cost savings and define follow-up activities.
Key part of the job is data extraction, setting up processes and systems to make working with data more efficient and presenting data to the wider audience.
You will work closely with our DevOps and Finance teams to ensure we maintain our cloud cost spend and environment stability through data analysis, consulting, accurate documentation, and creative problem-solving.
Qualifications
Strong financial analysis skills, including forecasting, budgeting, and cost analysis using tools like Excel, PowerBI, or other financial modeling tools.Solid understanding of accounting principles and practices, ensuring accurate financial reporting.Experience in budget management, including development, tracking, and forecasting of spending.Familiarity with cloud cost optimization strategies, such as rightsizing, reserved instances, and spot instances.Proficiency in using cloud cost management tools like Azure Cost Management for monitoring and controlling spending.Understanding of Azure services and pricing models to optimize cloud usage and reduce costs.Ability to identify and resolve billing issues or discrepancies with cloud vendors and internal stakeholders.Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work with stakeholders across finance, IT, and business teams.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills for identifying cost optimization opportunities and troubleshooting.Proficient in creating detailed financial reports and dashboards for insights and optimization in cloud spending.Knowledge of compliance and regulatory requirements, including security and data protection.Experience with automation and scripting tools to optimize cloud usage, reduce costs, and improve efficiency.Familiarity with Azure DevOps for optimizing cloud usage and automating workflows.Project management skills for effectively managing and prioritizing multiple initiatives.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, managing competing priorities and adapting to changing requirements.Understanding of agile methodologies for iterative and incremental progress in cost optimization.Mentoring and training skills to educate finance and IT teams on cloud cost optimization strategies.Relevant certifications, such as Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate or Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert, showcasing proficiency in Azure and cloud cost optimization.
Additional Information
Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We‚Äôre a fastpaced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience,
and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us
At Unit4, we offer:
 a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful, balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being, talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry, a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet, a safe and inclusive working environment ‚Äì supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
It‚Äôs an exciting time to join Tactile. We're one of the largest Danish gaming companies and we have been scaling fast in the last few years. Our dedication to creating top-quality games with global appeal has led to the development of a series of highly successful puzzle mobile games, such as Lily's Garden, Cookie Cats, Simon's Cat, and most recently, Penny&Flo: Finding HomeCurrently we are looking for a Data Science expert to join our Games Team.
As a Data Scientist at Tactile you will have the opportunity to explore data and take the initiative to acquire valuable insights that could help us improve our player‚Äôs experience. In your day to day, you‚Äôll be partnering up with game designers and other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization. Project after project you‚Äôll be helping evolve the analytics methodologies and tools available company-wide.
We have a growing portfolio of successful games, so you‚Äôll have the chance to assist game development through all of their different stages, from ideation, to soft-launch, to the long-term optimization of top ranking games.
This role is based in Barcelona.
What we‚Äôre looking for:Prior experience working within mobile gamingExperience using SQL to extract and transform large data-setsProficiency in R or PythonHigh proficiency in presenting analyses and results to all audiences, from senior stakeholders to junior colleagues and non-technical teammatesExperience applying rigorous analytic techniques in order to understand the behaviour of our players and the way they interact with the game featuresExperience with data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Periscope, Table)Understanding of statistical concepts such as sampling, distributions, hypothesis testing and confidence intervalsStrong experience and deep understanding of A/B testing methodologiesFamiliarity with collaborative programming (e.g., git), and other tools like Airflow and Docker
Great if you also have:Leadership experience
What we offer:üíª A chance to work with the latest tools and technologyüìö Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses ü•≥ Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

title: Data / ML Engineer
description:
Overview
preferred location: Barcelona
Data & ML Engineer will partner with Europe Advanced Analytics COE team to deliver number of Advanced Analytics use cases and data products leading activities around data aquisition, data modellig & architecture, advanced analytics platforms and data science toolkit management.
She/He will collaborate with Data Scientists and IT Data & Analytics teams to design and develop data concepts and digital solutions, and to industrialize ML solutions.

Data Engineering

Other ML tasks:
Implement model explainability Security applied to ML Protect people and their data. Prevent data exposure Responsible AI Ethics applied to ML, remove biases
Qualifications
Technical Skills:

title: Head of Master Data Management
description:
The Siegfried Group is a global life science company with a network of 11 sites in Europe, the USA, and Asia. Siegfried offers contract development and manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients, intermediates, and drug products. Siegfried has sales of 1.2 billion Swiss Francs and employs over 3,600 people. Siegfried Holding AG is listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange (SIX: SFZN).
Within this context, we are currently looking to fill the position of Head of Master Data Management in our Site of Barber√† del Vall√®s (Barcelona). In this role you will define the future of our digital footprint by driving improvements of day-to-day tasks and processes as well as by playing a driving role in all strategic projects while expanding our global production network organically and by mergers and acquisitions.
If you see yourself as a hands-on leader capable of driving change, this role could be just perfect for you.
The Role
As Head of Master Data Management, you will lead a global team of 5 people and provide functional leadership to all master data teams of the 11 Siegfried sites. In addition, you will directly report to the Chief Information Officer (based in Switzerland).
Your responsibilities
Redefine the global master data concept for product related data and business partners and ensure proper Data Governance across the company
Promote and oversee initiatives to improve processes in SAP and support in this process the various specialist departments
Manage the global Master Data project for the SAP S/4 roll-out
Shape - from the MDM point of view - any integration project running in the 11 Siegfried Sites and in our expanding global network
Create and oversee the life cycle of Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's) related to global Master Data tasks
Your Profile
A Degree in computer science, computer engineering or in a related discipline as well as several years of experience as project manager would give you the ideal background for the role
Proven ability to lead, coach, and motivate employees, clearly communicate job requirements and effectively manage the performance of the assigned tasks, while keeping a "hands-on" mentality is key in this role
Solid knowledge of SAP is fundamental to carry out this role successfully
Proven track record in Master Data Management
You speak English fluently, and ideally have some knowledge of German. Spanish would also be considered an advantage as the position is located in Barcelona region
Why joining Siegfried in Barber√† del Vall√®s
 Competitive performance-based bonusGenerous employee Share Matching PlanCanteen on-site strongly subsidized from the company or Restaurant Ticket: to eat out or to use when doing home officeMedical, life and accident insuranceAccess to "Club Siegfried": an exclusive platform with discounts and offers on more than 400 servicesContribution to nursery costsFree parking or shuttle bus from the city of Barcelona
